0.title: BMC to install tree tubs with wheels to prevent uprooting of plants
0.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to install tree tubs with wheels to prevent trees from being uprooted during any construction work. Under Phase-I of the project, 500 such tubs will be placed in open spaces and footpaths in the Worli area. According to a BMC official, the initiative will help in increasing the green cover of the city.

1.title: Play frontal role in war against gangsters: Punjab CM tells senior police officers
1.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has asked the Commissioners of Police and Senior Superintendents of Police to play a frontal role in the war against gangsters by personally conducting operations and interrogations. "You will be personally held responsible for any breach of law and order in your jurisdiction as you are accountable under the law," the CM further said.

2.title: Nigerian sentenced to 10 years in prison for smuggling heroin into Mohali
2.article_body: A 39-year-old Nigerian man was sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for smuggling heroin into Mohali. The local court also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on him. Based on a tip-off that a man will be entering Mohali with heroin, police had stopped and checked him on suspicion in 2018. They'd recovered 260 grams of heroin from him.

3.title: Curfew extended in Rajasthan's Karauli till April 10 after communal clashes
3.article_body: The curfew imposed in Rajasthan's Karauli, where communal clashes broke out, has been extended till 12 am on April 10, the administration has announced. The curfew will be relaxed between 9 am and 12 pm daily for general stores, dairies, fuel stations and others to function, it added. Mobile internet services continue to remain suspended in Karauli.

4.title: Why was DC's Anrich Nortje barred from bowling after 14 deliveries vs LSG?
4.article_body: DC fast bowler Anrich Nortje was barred from bowling after delivering 14 balls against LSG in IPL 2022 on Thursday night. The 28-year-old pacer, featuring in his first IPL 2022 match, was taken off the attack after bowling two beamers. He bowled his first over-the-waist ball in the 14th over and the second beamer in the 16th over.

5.title: Forest dept gives nod to Delhi Metro to fell over 3,000 trees
5.article_body: Forest Department has given its nod to the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to fell or transplant 2,940 trees in the North Forest Division and 450 trees in the South Forest Division. In the North division, 1,963 are to be transplanted, and 977 trees will be felled. In the South Division, 299 will be transplanted, and 151 will be felled.

6.title: BharatPe CEO apologises for salary remark; firm says all employees got March salary
6.article_body: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer apologised for his remarks in which he indicted that Ashneer Grover "stole money" from the company and little is left to pay salaries. An employee had raised the matter of sacking of admin staff and non-payment of salaries, to which Ashneer and Suhail had responded. Meanwhile, BharatPe clarified that all employees were given their March salary.

7.title: Major fire reported at industrial unit with chemical storage in Pimpri Chinchwad
7.article_body: A major fire was reported at an industrial unit with a chemical storage in Pimpri Chinchwad's Moshi area on Thursday night. Large plastic drums storing industrial chemicals aggravated the fire into a major blaze, a fire official said, adding that some explosions were heard initially. The nature of the chemicals and details of the damages are yet to be ascertained.

8.title: Will continue to fight till last ball: Pak PM as he faces ouster vote
8.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan said he would "continue to fight for Pakistan till the last ball" as the country's Supreme Court ordered that a no-confidence vote against him will take place on April 9. The court on Thursday set aside the National Assembly Deputy Speaker's ruling to dismiss the vote seeking to oust Khan. Pakistan's opposition hailed the court's decision.

9.title: 39-yr-old Hyderabad man beaten to death for misbehaving with woman
9.article_body: A 39-year-old man was beaten to death in Hyderabad for allegedly misbehaving with a woman. According to police, the man misbehaved with the woman near her house on Wednesday, following which her husband, along with some local residents, beat him with sticks. Subsequently, the man went to his house, but his family members found him dead that night, police added.

10.title: Cargo plane splits in two after emergency landing at Costa Rica airport
10.article_body: A DHL cargo plane slid off the runway and broke in half after it made an emergency landing at an airport in Costa Rica. DHL said the crew was unharmed and that one member was undergoing a medical review as a precaution. The fire department said the plane had detected a failure in the hydraulic system.

11.title: Mumbai Traffic Police to send drivers without helmets for counselling sessions
11.article_body: In a special drive against drivers found not wearing helmets, Mumbai Traffic Police has decided to impose fines through e-challans, suspend licence of such drivers for three months and also send them for two-hour-long counselling sessions. "In the last one month, we have fined over 75,000 bikers for driving without helmets," DCP Traffic (Headquarter and Central) Raj Tilak Roshan said.

12.title: 5-yr-old boy killed, grandfather injured as bike hits scooter in Delhi
12.article_body: A five-year-old boy was killed and his 58-year-old grandfather got injured after a bike hit their scooter in Southwest Delhi on Wednesday, police said. "The grandfather was...on his scooter with his two grandsons," Additional DCP Vikram Singh added. "We apprehended a 15-year-old boy...He said he was with his friend [on the bike]...were on their way home...they escaped afterwards," Singh stated.

13.title: B'luru Police ask temples, mosques to comply with noise pollution rules
13.article_body: Bengaluru Police have asked temples and mosques to comply with noise pollution rules and use the loudspeakers within the permissible decibel levels. Over 300 notices have been issued to establishments, including mosques, temples and churches, over the same, City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said. Reportedly, police have also started seizing mics from places that allegedly defied the orders.

14.title: 22-yr-old woman delivers baby boy at Delhi Metro Station platform
14.article_body: A 22-year-old woman on Thursday delivered a baby boy at Anand Vihar Metro Station in Delhi, officials said. The woman was waiting for the metro when she reportedly developed labour pain. A female CISF personnel and other women passengers arranged for a sheet and helped in the delivery of the baby boy at the platform, a senior CISF officer added.

15.title: Badoni finishes chase with a six in last over as LSG beat DC to win 3 matches in a row
15.article_body: LSG's 22-year-old batter Ayush Badoni finished the run chase with a six in the last over as his team defeated DC to register their third straight win in IPL 2022. DC had put up a total of 149/3 in their 20 overs, with Prithvi Shaw scoring 61(34). Quinton De Kock top-scored for LSG with 80(52).

16.title: Liverpool's Klopp insists clash with Man City will not decide PL title
16.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp insists that this weekend's match against Premier League leaders Manchester City will not decide the title in their favour. "If we win against City, which is already difficult enough, I think no one would think, 'that's it, decided', because of the quality of the opponent," he said. Liverpool are currently one point behind Manchester City.

17.title: Maxwel Cornet scores to help Burnley beat Everton 3-2 in PL
17.article_body: Maxwel Cornet scored in the 85th minute to help Burnley beat Everton 3-2 in the Premier League. The defeat means Everton are one point above the relegation zone in 17th place on the Premier League table. Burnley are one point behind Everton. Brazilian international Richarlison scored twice from the penalty spot to give Everton a 2-1 lead at half-time.

18.title: Faf Du Plessis has earned respect in RCB change room: Glenn Maxwell
18.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said that Faf Du Plessis has earned the respect of everyone in RCB change room. "Not only does he lead by example, with his actions, but he also performs really well," he said. Maxwell added, "To have a guy of his quality and caper up the top of the order is something that’s great for RCB."

19.title: Patrick Mouratoglou to coach former world no. 1 Simona Halep full-time
19.article_body: Frenchman Patrick Mouratoglou, long-time coach of Serena Williams, on Thursday said he will coach former world number one Simona Halep full-time. "In the last eight months, I realised how much I missed coaching. It is the passion of my life, and I still feel like I have so much to give," he said. Halep is a two-time Grand Slam champion.

20.title: Video shows Kerala student, born without legs, being carried by friends
20.article_body: A video shot by a wedding photographer shows a student in Kerala's Kollam district being carried by his friends inside the college campus as he was born without legs. The student, Alif Mohammed, is pursuing BCom. The photographer Jagath Thulaseedharan said, "For everyone inside the college, this is a common sight as Alif is always carried around by...his friends."

21.title: We still have plenty to learn: Mercedes boss Wolff ahead of Aus GP
21.article_body: Team boss Toto Wolff said Mercedes still has plenty to learn ahead of the Australian Grand Prix this weekend. "There won't be a magic fix for the next race weekend, but we're pushing to steadily bring gains over the upcoming races, to hopefully move us closer to the front of the pack," he said referring to Ferrari and Red Bull.

22.title: Digital Rupee won't eliminate cryptos in India: CEA Nageswaran
22.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said the introduction of a Central Bank Digital Currency, or Digital Rupee, won't lead to the elimination of cryptos and stablecoins as they satisfy different objectives. "Objective for cryptos to emerge is...tax evasion, money laundering and speculation...Therefore, they have to be tackled separately with other regulatory instruments," he said.

23.title: Want to seek EU membership separately from North Macedonia: Albania
23.article_body: Albania will approach European Union (EU) to enquire if it can pursue its membership bid separately from North Macedonia, Albanian PM Edi Rama said on Thursday. North Macedonia, which faces a veto by Bulgaria amid disputes between them, had been grouped with Albania by EU in their accession bid. "Albania cannot wait...until two neighbours resolve their quarrel," Rama added.

24.title: Why did India abstain from UNGA vote to suspend Russia from UNHRC?
24.article_body: India abstained from UNGA vote to suspend Russia from UNHRC following the killings in Ukraine. In its explanation, India said, "If India has chosen any side, it is the side of peace and it is for an immediate end to violence." India added, "Recent reports of civilian killings in Bucha are deeply disturbing...We support the call for an independent investigation."

25.title: Whistleblower alleges wrongdoing at Invesco Mutual Fund: Reports
25.article_body: A whistleblower has filed complaints with SEBI and US SEC about alleged mismanagement by Invesco Mutual Fund's fixed income team, Moneycontrol reported. Invesco is accused of having the same person holding the positions of Chief Investment Officer and Advisor to its offshore portfolio management services. The fixed income team is accused of executing trades on behalf of Invesco's offshore funds.

26.title: Pic of dresses draped on crosses near Canada site where kids were found buried wins award
26.article_body: An image of dresses draped on crosses near Kamloops in Canada, where remains of 215 children were found last year, won the 2022 World Press Photo of the Year award. The image was captured by Amber Bracken, who's the fifth female World Press Photo of the Year winner. It commemorates the children who died at the Kamloops Indian Residential School.

27.title: South films have been made in Hindi & vice versa for last 70-80 yrs: Abhishek
27.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has said that he has worked in remakes of South Indian films in the past. "South films have been made in Hindi and Hindi films have been made in the South for the last 70 to 80 years," he added. Abhishek's upcoming film will be a remake of the Tamil film 'Oththa Seruppu Size 7'.

28.title: Which are the most expensive overs in IPL history?
28.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel and ex-KTK pacer Prasanth Parameswaran hold the record for bowling the joint-most expensive over in IPL history, conceding 37 runs each. Harshal conceded 37 runs against CSK in IPL 2021, while Parameswaran conceded 37 runs against RCB in IPL 2011. They are followed by MI all-rounder Daniel Sams, who conceded 35 runs against KKR on Wednesday.

29.title: Ukrainian PM thanks UN for humanitarian aid, asks for more support
29.article_body: After meeting UN aid chief Martin Griffiths on Thursday, Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal took to Twitter and thanked the UN for the humanitarian aid it received since Russia's invasion. PM Shmyhal further "stressed the need to increase support and unite efforts to provide targeted financial assistance to Ukrainians suffering from Russian aggression". The Ukraine-Russia war entered its 43rd day today.

30.title: Belarus must be involved in negotiations over Ukraine crisis: Lukashenko
30.article_body: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko said on Thursday that his country must be involved in negotiations to resolve the conflict in Ukraine, adding that Belarus was "dragged' into it by the West. Lukashenko added that he expects to hold talks with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin soon. Notably, several Western countries have included Belarus in sanctions against Russia over the conflict.

31.title: 2 men die after entering manhole to find gold particles in Gujarat
31.article_body: Two men who had entered a 10-feet-deep manhole to find gold particles in Gujarat's Surat died of asphyxiation on Thursday.The manhole was in an area where several small jewellery manufacturing units are located. A local resident said, "Since there are several jewellery manufacturing units in this area, gold particles get washed into the sewer."

32.title: Which nations supported Russia in resolution seeking its suspension from UNHRC?
32.article_body: As many as 24 nations voted against the draft resolution to suspend Russia from UN Human Rights Council over Ukraine war. While UNGA passed the resolution with 93 countries in its favour, the nations that voted against included China, Belarus, Burundi, Algeria, Eritrea, Congo, Syria, Kazakhstan and Iran among others. Meanwhile, over 50 nations, including India, abstained from voting.

33.title: India & US to hold 2+2 dialogue in Washington on April 11
33.article_body: The MEA on Thursday informed that India and US will hold 2+2 dialogue on April 11 in Washington. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will hold talks with US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin and Secretary of State Anthony Blinken. "The...dialogue will...provide an opportunity to exchange views about important regional and global developments," MEA said.

34.title: Was no chance of getting wedding licence at that hour: Kourtney
34.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian, speaking about her marriage with Travis Barker not being legal, has said that they were unable to get the licence at that hour. "It was 2 am and they were like 'it opens at 8 o'clock'," she added. Kourtney and Travis got married at a chapel in Las Vegas hours after the Grammys 2022 ceremony.

35.title: UNGA suspends Russia from UNHRC; India abstains from voting
35.article_body: The UN General Assembly (UNGA) on Thursday suspended Russia from the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC). India abstained from the UN General Assembly vote. As many as 93 countries voted in the favour of the draft resolution, 24 countries voted against it and 58 countries abstained.

36.title: Pakistan PM Imran Khan loses court case, faces no-trust vote on Saturday
36.article_body: Pakistan Supreme Court has termed National Assembly Deputy Speaker's decision to dismiss the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan as "unconstitutional". The Supreme Court has restored the National Assembly and ordered Speaker to call for session on April 9 to organise no-confidence vote. On Sunday, the no-trust motion against Khan's government was dismissed by Deputy Speaker Qasim Suri.

37.title: Enjoyed myself while gaining 15 kgs for 'Dasvi': Nimrat Kaur
37.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur, in an episode of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', revealed that she gained 15 kgs for her film 'Dasvi'. "I had six months in hand so I put on weight at my own pace. I ate lots and enjoyed myself," she further said. The actress added director Tushar Jalota wanted her to look different from her previous characters.

38.title: Armenia & Azerbaijan agree to peace talks over Nagorno-Karabakh
38.article_body: Armenia and Azerbaijan have agreed to peace talks over disputed territory of Nagorno-Karabakh, following a meeting between the countries' leaders on Wednesday. The countries will set up bilateral border commission by April end, according to a statement by Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan. The move comes amid reports of recent clashes in region, two years after large-scale conflict broke out there.

39.title: No comments: India on political crisis in Imran Khan-led Pakistan govt
39.article_body: On being asked about political turmoil in Pakistan arising after Imran Khan's decision to dissolve country's National Assembly, India's External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "I have no comments." "We are watching developments but don't comment on such internal matters," he added. Pakistan's Deputy Speaker had rejected the no-confidence vote against Imran Khan.

40.title: Can do Telugu film & get seen around world: Mahesh on not doing Hindi films
40.article_body: Mahesh Babu has said, "I don't need to do Hindi films...can just do a Telugu film and it'll get seen all over the world." "You'd want to be in a position to do (only) a Telugu film," he added. This comes after Telugu films like 'Pushpa: The Rise' and 'RRR' collected over ₹300 crore and ₹200 crore, respectively, across India.

41.title: Former world no. 5 Tsonga to retire after French Open
41.article_body: Former world number five Jo-Wilfried Tsonga on Wednesday announced he will retire after the French Open this year. It will be the 15th time the Frenchman will play the French Open. "I've always set myself high goals to try and get what I can. For me, this will be the opportunity to do it one last time," the 36-year-old said.

42.title: Matteo Berrettini, Dominic Thiem withdraw from Monte Carlo Masters
42.article_body: World number six Matteo Berrettini and former US Open champion Dominic Thiem have pulled out of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. Thiem will miss the upcoming event as he continues his recovery after having tested positive for COVID-19 last week. Berrettini meanwhile misses out due to a minor operation he had on his playing hand last week.

43.title: India, Australia name officers' exchange programme after CDS Rawat
43.article_body: Indian and Australian governments have announced an Australia-India Young Defence Officers' Exchange Programme in memory of late CDS General Bipin Rawat, who was killed in a helicopter crash in December. The programme will be named after General Rawat, Australia's High Commissioner to India Barry O'Farrell said. General Rawat took over as CDS after serving as Army chief for three years.

44.title: Jr NTR says 'SS Rajamouli should make RRR 2', director replies
44.article_body: Actor Jr NTR has said that director SS Rajamouli should make a sequel to their recently released film 'RRR'. "There needs to be a conclusion to this also," Jr NTR stated. Ram Charan added, "We all will be delighted again if Rajamouli sir thinks of RRR 2." To this, Rajamouli replied, "For me, it would be a great pleasure."

45.title: BJP's Kirron Kher meets SP's Jaya Bachchan in Parliament, shares pic
45.article_body: BJP MP from Chandigarh Kirron Kher on Thursday met Rajya Sabha MP from Samajwadi Party Jaya Bachchan in the Parliament. Sharing the picture on social media, Kher wrote, "Wonderful to meet Jaya after so long in Parliament." The Budget Session of the Parliament ended today, a day ahead of the schedule. It had started on January 31.

46.title: Austria expels 4 Russian diplomats for breach of norms
46.article_body: Austria on Thursday announced expulsion of four Russian diplomats for engaging in activities incompatible with their diplomatic status. Three envoys working at Russian Embassy in Vienna and one staffer working at Russian Consulate General in Salzburg have been asked to leave Austria by April 12. Austria joins France and Italy, among other European countries, which recently expelled Russian envoys.

47.title: 2 US personnel injured in an apparent rocket attack in Syria: Officials
47.article_body: Two US personnel were injured after an apparent rocket struck the US Air Force base overnight in Syria, officials said on Thursday. According to a report, the US-led forces also returned fire after the rockets were launched from an area where Iran-backed militias have a presence. However, no one has claimed responsibility for the attack so far.

48.title: When I put on weight, people said I am pregnant: Nargis Fakhri
48.article_body: Speaking about facing body shaming, Nargis Fakhri said, "When I first came to India, I was too skinny, so everyone was like 'You need to put on weight'." "Later I gained about 50 pounds, so they posted I was pregnant, which I thought was not funny, but also very funny. I think...my feelings got hurt," she added.

49.title: Tharoor clarifies after pic with Supriya Sule goes viral, says 'she was speaking softly'
49.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has issued a clarification after a picture of him chatting with Supriya Sule during Farooq Abdullah's speech in Parliament went viral. "She was asking me a policy question because she was about to speak next. She was speaking softly so as not to disturb Farooq Sahib, so I leaned over to hear her," he tweeted.

50.title: 429 interns worked with MEA in last 5 years: S Jaishankar
50.article_body: As many as 429 interns have worked in the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) over the last five years, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar told the Rajya Sabha on Thursday. He added, "The MEA has been engaging interns for a decade, reflecting an intent to expand the foreign policy discourse in the country and tap into talent beyond the government."

51.title: No pressure on India over trade with Russia: MEA
51.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), when asked about western pressure over trade with Russia, said, "Don't think there's any such pressure. Talks of sanctions going on but it's not on the entire trade." The MEA added, "Our focus is to maintain and stabilise our established economic relations with Russia."

52.title: Opposition front not 'enough' to take on BJP: Sisodia
52.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday said that the formation of an Opposition front "would not be enough to take on the BJP". People have realised BJP's methods of winning elections, which they do by diverting attention from the main issues but do nothing for the masses after forming the government, he said.

53.title: Ayodhya Airport must be ready along with Ram Temple: Yogi to officials
53.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Thursday told officials that the Maryada Purushottam Shri Ram International Airport in Ayodhya should be functional "by the time Ram Lalla moves to his new temple next year". He said air connectivity will help connect history with the present time and make Ayodhya the "most beautiful city in the world".

54.title: Onus on Pakistan to create terror-free environment for trade: Govt
54.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said India is committed to addressing issues with Pakistan and asserted that the onus of maintaining a terror and hostility-free environment for such an engagement is on Pakistan. Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan said, "India desires normal neighbourly relations." Pakistan suspended trade with India in August 2019, Muraleedharan added.

55.title: Why did we elect govt?: SC on plea to deport illegal immigrants
55.article_body: While hearing a plea filed by BJP leader and advocate Ashwini Upadhyay seeking directions for government to identify and detain all illegal immigrants within a year, CJI NV Ramana on Thursday expressed concern over SC being burdened by politically sensitive matters. "If we have to take up all your PILs, then why did we elect the government," he asked.

56.title: Number of global COVID-19 cases, deaths fell last week: WHO
56.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization (WHO) said global COVID-19 cases and deaths fell during the week of March 28 through April 3. Over nine million cases were reported across the six WHO regions last week, a 16% decrease compared to the week before. Global COVID-19 deaths also dropped by 43% with over 26,000 new deaths reported.

57.title: Voters don’t accept Babul Supriyo: CPM candidate on Bengal bypolls
57.article_body: Ahead of West Bengal Assembly bypolls, CPM's candidate from Ballygunge constituency, Saira Shah Halim, said on Wednesday that people aren't willing to vote for Trinamool Congress' (TMC) Babul Supriyo. Halim, who is also actor Naseeruddin Shah's niece, added that Supriyo is seen as "anti-minority" and isn't accepted by 'Bangali Bhadralok' (Bengali intellectuals). Supriyo resigned from BJP in 2021.

58.title: 7 heat-related deaths reported in last 2 weeks in Maharashtra
58.article_body: Maharashtra reported seven heat-related deaths and 59 heatstroke cases in the past fortnight, as per the state health department. Three deaths were reported from Jalgaon, two from Nagpur and one each from Akola and Osmanabad. With the maximum temperature settling at 44°C, Akola has been the hottest city in the country for the last three days.

59.title: Making contingency plans for possible chemical assaults in Ukraine: WHO
59.article_body: WHO's European head Hans Kluge on Thursday said that it's preparing for possible "chemical assaults" in Ukraine. Kluge said, "WHO is considering all scenarios and making contingencies for different situations that could afflict the people of Ukraine, from the continued treatment of mass casualties to chemical assaults." There are no assurances that the war will not get worse, Kluge added.

60.title: US will boycott G20 meeting if Russia is allowed to attend: Yellen
60.article_body: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said US will boycott "a number of G20 meetings" if Russian officials are allowed to attend. "President Biden has made it clear, and I certainly agree with him, that it cannot be business as usual for Russia in any of the financial institutions," Yellen said. She added Russia should be expelled from the Group of 20.

61.title: 'Goondagardi' not good for country: Kejriwal on BJP after attack
61.article_body: Criticising BJP for the attack on his house, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that "goondagardi is not good for the country". "The protesters were people from the BJP. They came to my house and climbed the walls. My elderly parents were there. We weren't there at home," he further added.

62.title: Pic shows YouTuber, journalists stripped to their underwear at a police station in MP
62.article_body: A picture of journalists and YouTuber Kanishk Tiwari stripped to their underwear at a police station in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi has surfaced online. Tiwari said they had gone to the station to cover the arrest of theatre artist Neeraj Kunder who was arrested for allegedly making indecent remarks about BJP MLA Kedarnath Shukla. "We were beaten, abused," Tiwari added.

63.title: Half of critics who wrote me off now ask me for work as writers: John
63.article_body: Actor John Abraham said half of the critics who wrote him off after every film during his initial acting days come to him for work as writers. "They say...'We're very sorry'," he stated. John added, "Now when they come to me for work...I try and help them and say...'You could have been good critics, you're failed writers but no problem'."

64.title: CBI makes first arrests in Birbhum violence case, nabs 4 from Mumbai
64.article_body: Days after at least nine people were killed in West Bengal's Birbhum, the CBI on Thursday arrested four people in Mumbai in connection with the case. These are the first arrests made by the CBI since it took over the case last month. Miscreants had allegedly set around 10-12 houses on fire in Birbhum's Bogtui village on March 21.

65.title: Amit Shah should be last person to talk about law & order: TMC leader
65.article_body: Trinamool Congress leader Saugata Roy criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah for his remarks on the law and order situation in West Bengal, adding that he should be the last person to talk about it. "We are very well aware of his track record as a Minister in Gujarat and in the Union government," he said.

66.title: No election symbol allotted by EC will be deemed national symbol: Rijiju
66.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju told Rajya Sabha on Thursday that no election symbol allotted by Election Commission (EC) will be deemed as religious or national one. Rijiju's reply came after he was asked whether symbols like national bird etc, can be used by political parties. He added that government has no proposal to disallow use of national symbols by parties.

67.title: It's revolting: Presenter who received 31 videos of penis from a man on Instagram
67.article_body: A man sent 31 videos of his penis to Britain's 36-year-old TV presenter Rachel Riley through Instagram direct messages (DMs), Center for Countering Digital Hate (CCDH) researchers found. Riley, actress Amber Heard and other celebrities gave their social media accounts to non-profit CCDH for monitoring DMs. "It makes me not want to go into my DMs because...it's revolting," Riley said.

68.title: BankBazaar plans IPO in 2023; seeks to hire 1,500 employees
68.article_body: Online financial services marketplace BankBazaar plans to list an IPO in 2023, the company said on Thursday. After reporting revenue growth in FY22, the Sequoia India and Amazon-backed firm also plans to recruit over 1,500 employees across departments this year aiming to expand its product offerings. BankBazaar reported annualised revenue run rate of ₹156 crore, the company added.

69.title: Maharashtra will continue to stand tall before central agencies: Raut
69.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Thursday said Maharashtra will continue to stand tall before central agencies like the Enforcement Directorate and Narcotics Control Bureau. "Those who've announced a war against us and Maharashtra, I want to tell them that we're ready...A time will come when you will have to bow down on your knees before us," Raut added.

70.title: LSG, DC announce their playing XIs, DC make 3 changes as Warner returns
70.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against DC in their IPL 2022 encounter on Thursday. LSG have made one change to their playing XI, with Krishnappa Gowtham replacing Manish Pandey. DC have made three changes, with David Warner, Sarfaraz Khan and Anrich Nortje replacing Tim Seifert, Mandeep Singh and Khaleel Ahmed, respectively.

71.title: Was offered Heropanti 2 while shooting another film in UK: Nawazuddin
71.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui said he was offered 'Heropanti 2' while he was filming for another movie in London. "They narrated the character to me while we were travelling to a...location...later we took...narration to the hotel," he added. Nawazuddin stated he was impressed when writer Rajat Arora and director Ahmed Khan narrated the character with "a lot of zeal and enthusiasm".

72.title: Over 100 weapons banned for import to boost self-reliance: Rajnath Singh
72.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday released the third list of over 101 military systems and weapons that will come under an import ban and be developed indigenously to boost self-reliance. "Our two important objectives are self-reliance in the defence sector and promoting exports of military equipment," Singh said. He added that self-reliance doesn't mean isolation from the world.

73.title: 'Dasvi' review says 'Yami no longer the dead girlfriend in Hindi films', actress reacts
73.article_body: Yami Gautam reacted to a review of her performance in 'Dasvi', which read, "Yami...is no longer...the dead girlfriend in Hindi films, but the...combative smile is starting to get repetitive." "I usually take constructive criticism in my stride. But when a...platform keeps trying to pull you down, I felt it necessary to speak up," she said while calling it "extremely disrespectful".

74.title: Actor Sreenivasan on ventilator after undergoing bypass surgery
74.article_body: Malayalam actor and filmmaker Sreenivasan has undergone bypass surgery after the 66-year-old complained of severe chest pain. "Sreenivasan is responding well to Treatments and Medications," a health bulletin from the hospital read. According to the reports, the veteran actor has been put on a ventilator after the surgery. The actor was admitted to the hospital on March 30.

75.title: 30-yr-old abused, beaten by 3 for sporting a moustache in MP
75.article_body: A 30-year-old man was allegedly abused and beaten by three men for sporting a moustache in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, police said on Wednesday. The accused, Bunty Godha, his brother, Naveen Godha and another accomplice, were agitated over the victim's moustache, abused him and one of the accused beat him with a stick, a policeman said, quoting the complaint.

76.title: Exploring all options to procure affordable crude oil: Govt
76.article_body: Centre is exploring all viable options to procure crude oil at affordable rates, the Finance Ministry said. Rise in imports in March because of an increase in oil prices "doesn't portend well for the economy in the year ahead", the Ministry added. If fuel was available at a discount, India would buy it, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had said earlier.

77.title: German Parliament to vote on COVID-19 vaccine mandate for elderly
77.article_body: The German Parliament known as Bundestag will vote on a series of proposals, including a COVID-19 vaccine mandate for those over 60, that is seen as likely to be approved. A simple majority is required for a proposal to pass. A recent opinion poll showed that about 60% of Germans are in favour of a COVID-19 vaccine mandate.

78.title: Person with suspected XE COVID-19 variant in Mumbai has recovered: Aaditya
78.article_body: Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray tweeted on Thursday that the person suspected to be infected with the XE coronavirus variant in Mumbai has recovered. The high-risk contacts of the person have tested negative, he added. "The samples have been sent to NIBMG, to reconfirm the type of strain. We are constantly working to ensure that we are all safe," he added.

79.title: Sonu Sood swaps his business class seat with economy class seat to help elderly man
79.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, who was returning from South Africa, offered his business class seat to an elderly man. He swapped his business class seat for an economy class seat. When the same was revealed in a tweet, Sonu wrote, "Sometimes economy seats are more comfortable than the business class seats."

80.title: Lemon prices touch ₹400 per kg in Rajasthan's Jaipur
80.article_body: Lemon prices have increased in several parts of the country amid soaring temperatures and touched ₹400 per kilogram in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Wednesday. On Tuesday, lemons were selling for ₹340 per kilogram in Jaipur. Traders at local mandis said vegetable prices soar during the summers, but an increase in the prices of fuel is triggering the price rise of produce.

81.title: Withdraw look out circular against ex-Amnesty India chief: Court tells CBI
81.article_body: A Delhi court on Thursday asked CBI to withdraw the look out circular issued against former Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel in a Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) case. He approached the court after he was stopped from flying to the US from Bengaluru on Wednesday. CBI claimed he may flee from justice as he is an influential person.

82.title: Britain to step up supply of military equipment to Ukraine: Truss
82.article_body: Britain's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said UK is stepping up its supply of military equipment to Ukraine. "In the face of Putin's appalling aggression in Ukraine, the G7 and NATO are stepping up our efforts on sanctions and on weapons," Truss said during a NATO meeting of foreign ministers in Brussels. Ukraine's government issued a plea for "weapons, weapons, weapons".

83.title: Maha govt launches e-learning app for Ukraine returned students
83.article_body: Maharashtra Medical Education Minister Amit Deshmukh on Thursday launched an e-learning solution for medical students who have returned from the war-torn country of Ukraine. He also launched a mobile information app of the Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS), Nashik. "Steps are being taken by the state to introduce a medical college, hospital and research centre," said Deshmukh.

84.title: Fans abused me, Ganguly said 'They'll kill you': Akhtar on dismissing Sachin in Mumbai
84.article_body: Recalling dismissing Sachin Tendulkar in an IPL match in Mumbai, ex-Pakistan and KKR pacer Shoaib Akhtar said, "I dismissed him in first over...that was a huge mistake." Akhtar added, "I got a lot of abuses when I was at fine leg. Sourav Ganguly said, 'Come to mid-wicket...these people will kill you. Who told you to dismiss Sachin...that too in Mumbai?'"

85.title: Russia's ruble surges to the level it was before Putin invaded Ukraine
85.article_body: Russia's ruble has surged back to the levels where it was before President Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine, trading at 74.2625 per dollar in early Moscow trade on Thursday. This comes as foreign countries continue to buy Russian oil and natural gas, supporting the ruble. International sanctions had earlier sunk the ruble to a record low of 121.5 rubles per dollar.

86.title: Australia to impose further sanctions on 67 Russians over Ukraine
86.article_body: Australia's Foreign Minister Marise Payne on Thursday said the country will impose financial sanctions and travel bans on 67 Russian individuals over Ukraine invasion. Payne said the new sanctions follow "the emergence of evidence of war crimes committed by Russia in Bucha and other towns around Kyiv." Russian Deputy PM Dmitry Grigorenko is among those individuals newly sanctioned by Australia.

87.title: Want Big B to be my jail inmate, Karan Johar will be wonderful CM: Nimrat
87.article_body: When asked which Bollywood actor she would like to take along with her inside a lock-up for 10 days, Nimrat Kaur replied Amitabh Bachchan. "I have always wanted to work with him...it's a big wish," she added. She further said filmmaker Karan Johar will make a "wonderful" Chief Minister. "Karan will be so lovely, so warm, and entertaining," Nimrat stated.

88.title: Principal helps students cheat in Class 10 board exam in Haryana, held
88.article_body: The principal of a government school, a teacher and two staff members have been arrested for allegedly helping students cheat in the Class 10 board exam for Hindi subject, police said. Computers, two printer-cum-photostat machines and some slips to help the students have been seized from the school. The matter was reported after a complaint by the flying squad.

89.title: First 10,000 e-cycle buyers in Delhi to get ₹5,500 subsidy: Gahlot
89.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot on Thursday said the Delhi government will provide a subsidy of ₹5,500 each for the first 10,000 buyers of e-cycles. An additional subsidy of ₹2,000 will be provided to the first 1,000 buyers. Subsidy will also be given on purchase of heavy duty cargo e-cycles and e-carts, he said.

90.title: UN to vote on Russia's suspension from Human Rights Council
90.article_body: The UN General Assembly on Thursday will vote to suspend Russia from the UN Human Rights Council. The US pushed for a vote following reports of "gross and systematic violations and abuses of human rights" by Russian troops in Ukraine. A two-thirds majority of the 193-member General Assembly is required to suspend a nation from the 47-member council.

91.title: UAE's Abu Dhabi to ban single-use plastic bags from June
91.article_body: Authorities in Abu Dhabi, the capital city of United Arab Emirates (UAE), announced on Wednesday that single-use plastic bags will be banned from June. The Environment Agency-Abu Dhabi (EAD) said that it will phase out use of products like styrofoam cups and food containers by 2024. Notably, Dubai will begin charging a fee on use of plastic bags from July.

92.title: We will respond: Russia after US imposes sanctions on Putin's daughters
92.article_body: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Thursday said that Russia will "definitely respond" to new US sanctions against Russia and President Vladimir Putin's relatives. He said, "Russia will definitely respond and will do it the way it considers necessary." This comes after the US on Wednesday announced new sanctions on Russian financial institutions and individuals, including Putin's two daughters.

93.title: Delhi Minorities Commission issues show cause notice over meat ban
93.article_body: The Delhi Minorities Commission on Thursday issued show cause notices to the Mayors and Commissioners of Delhi's three municipal corporations seeking an explanation for their decision to order meat vendors to close their shops during Navratri. "Senior authorities and the courts should step in and put a stop to such behaviour," said Delhi Minorities Commission Chairperson Zakir Khan.

94.title: Pic of Rishi, Neetu's reception card goes viral ahead of Ranbir, Alia's rumoured wedding
94.article_body: Ahead of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's rumoured wedding, a picture of Ranbir's parents Rishi and Neetu Kapoor's reception card has gone viral. Their reception was held on January 23, 1980, a day after they got married. Several reports have claimed that Ranbir and Alia will get married this month.

95.title: Fintech firm Bolt to buy crypto firm Wyre in $1.5 bn deal: Reports
95.article_body: Payments-focused fintech firm Bolt Financial is buying crypto-services startup Wyre Payments in a $1.5 billion deal, Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday. This would be the largest merger in the crypto sector that didn't involve a special purpose acquisition company, according to research firm Dealogic. Wyre last year connected to the Visa network after joining its Fintech Fast Track Program.

96.title: MNS' Pune chief removed after his different view on loudspeakers' removal
96.article_body: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has removed Vasant More as the party's Pune chief, days after he took a different stand on party chief Raj Thackeray's directive on the removal of loudspeakers from mosques. Thackeray has now appointed Sainath Babar as the party's Pune chief. More said that he was not asked or informed to resign from the post.

97.title: Entire Andhra Pradesh cabinet resigns as CM Jagan prepares new cabinet
97.article_body: As Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy is preparing a new cabinet, all 24 cabinet ministers resigned on Thursday after completing their final cabinet meeting. The ministers sent their resignations to Reddy at the state secretariat. Notably, the YSRCP chief had planned to reshuffle his cabinet in December 2021, but it was postponed due to the coronavirus pandemic.

98.title: Your brother stole all money: BharatPe CEO to Ashneer's sister on unpaid salaries
98.article_body: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer responded, "Your brother stole all the money...Very little left to pay salaries," to a comment by Ashneer Grover's sister on LinkedIn, criticising him for not paying salaries to some employees. Sameer later apologised and removed the comment. The comments were made on a LinkedIn post by a BharatPe employee who was demanding his salary for March.

99.title: May face impairment losses of up to $5 bn due to Russia exit: Shell
99.article_body: Oil and natural gas giant Shell is writing off $4 billion to $5 billion in assets after it pulled its operations in Russia. On March 8, Shell announced that it would exit the Russian oil and natural gas sector and close all its service stations in response to the Russia-Ukraine war. "These charges are expected to be identified," Shell said.

100.title: How much tax is collected in each state for petrol?
100.article_body: Petrol prices differ from state to state depending on local taxation (VAT) and freight charges apart from excise duty charged by the Centre. Taking ₹100/litre as base price of petrol for every state, an Indian Express infographic citing government data states that tax paid in Maharashtra is ₹65.22, Delhi is ₹48.5, Uttarakhand is ₹46.07, Karnataka is ₹55.02, Telangana is ₹64.3.

101.title: Russia facing most difficult situation in 3 decades amid sanctions: PM
101.article_body: Russian PM Mikhail Mishustin on Thursday said the country is facing the most difficult situation in three decades due to unprecedented Western sanctions over Ukraine. He, however, added that the foreign attempts to isolate Russia from the global economy would fail. Notably, the United States has announced new sanctions on Russian individuals, including President Vladimir Putin's two daughters.

102.title: Everyone should comply with K'taka HC's order on loudspeakers: Kharge
102.article_body: Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge said on Thursday that all communities must abide by Karnataka High Court's (HC) order to curb use of loudspeakers in religious institutions. He, however, added that such issues shouldn't be brought up for polarisation purposes. Kharge's comment comes after Karnataka government said it wants to implement HC's order on regulating sound volume of loudspeakers in mosques.

103.title: Coca-Cola to set up 2nd plant worth ₹1,000 cr in Telangana
103.article_body: Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages on Thursday signed a partnership with the Telangana government and announced a fresh investment of ₹1,000 crore for setting up their second factory in the state. Coca-Cola will initially invest ₹600 crore in the new facility and add another ₹400 crore over the next five years, reports said. The facility will manufacture packaged beverages, juices and more.

104.title: Video shows AIMIM corporator arguing with police over parking in Hyd
104.article_body: A video shows AIMIM corporator Syed Sohail Quadri getting into an altercation with the police over a parking issue near the Mecca Mosque. Several vehicles were parked near the mosque and police had gone there to remove the vehicles. The corporator also spoke with the Superintendent of Police on the phone over the matter.

105.title: Will begin shooting for film with Akshay Kumar in 2023: Priyadarshan
105.article_body: Filmmaker Priyadarshan has said that the shooting of his upcoming film with actor Akshay Kumar will begin in 2023. "My film with Akshay is on the scripting stage. Few things are happening, and the film got delayed because of COVID-19," he said. Speaking about the sequel to his 2004 film 'Hulchul', Priyadarshan said, "I have not decided anything."

106.title: Manipur minister meets girl, who attended school with sister in lap
106.article_body: Manipur minister Thongam Biswajit Singh on Wednesday met Meiningsinliu Pamei, the 10-year-old girl who attended school while her two-year-old sister sat in her lap. Pamei's picture had gone viral earlier. "We have decided to assist her education through a boarding school and promised her parents that I will be looking after all her expenses till she graduates," Singh tweeted.

107.title: Russia's key objective is to capture all of Ukraine: Minister
107.article_body: Amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war, Ukrainian Deputy Defence Minister Hanna Malyar has said that Russia's long-term objective is to seize all of Ukraine. Malyar said, "The key objective of the Russian Federation was and is the capture of the entire territory of Ukraine." However, Russia said its "special military operation" in Ukraine is aimed at "demilitarising" and "denazifying" the country.

108.title: Muslim govt employees can leave offices 1 hr early during Ramzan in Andhra
108.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government on Thursday said government employees, teachers, contractual employees and outsourcing officers, who follow Islam, can leave offices one hour early on all working days during Ramzan. They can leave early till May 2, the order signed by Chief Secretary Dr Sameer Sharma read. Earlier, Delhi Jal Board passed a similar order but withdrew it later.

109.title: SP MLA's petrol pump razed with bulldozers in UP, video surfaces
109.article_body: A petrol pump owned by SP MLA Shazil Islam Ansari was razed with bulldozers by district officials after claiming that it was built without necessary permission in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. A video of the incident has surfaced online. This comes days after a purported video clip showed Ansari making provocative remarks against CM Yogi Adityanath.

110.title: Pant is very exciting as he takes the game on in any situation: Watson
110.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said captain Rishabh Pant is very exciting to watch as he takes the game on in any situation. "Pant reads the game really well which you can see with the way he has developed his own game, and the progress that he has made. He will always be a good leader," stated Ajit Agarkar.

111.title: Women oppressed in showbiz for a long time, we are like beaten dogs: Eiza
111.article_body: Hollywood actress Eiza Gonzalez Reyna said women have been oppressed in the showbiz industry for a long time, adding that they are similar to beaten dogs. "I don't have to just oblige to the rules that the industry has in a parameter for me," stated Eiza. "I can be a multi-hyphenated personality and do many things," said Eiza.

112.title: Musk denies selling Twitter shares, says 'initial number was incorrect'
112.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has refuted reports claiming he had reduced his stake in Twitter from 9.2% to 9.1%. "No sale took place. Initial share number filed was incorrect," he said in response to a claim that he had sold 371,900 Twitter shares. A filing on Tuesday showed that the Tesla CEO had taken a 9.1% stake in Twitter.

113.title: Development revenue runs out: Pawar on AAP's free electricity scheme
113.article_body: While speaking on the Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government's free electricity and water scheme, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that people like freebies but political parties must think about long-term development. Pawar further said that development revenue runs out in providing water and electricity for free to people. He also urged the Centre to reduce tax on fuel.

114.title: SpaceX, US govt's USAID deliver 5,000 Starlink teminals to Ukraine
114.article_body: The United States Agency for International Development (USAID) said it has provided 5,000 Starlink satellite internet terminals to Ukraine, in partnership with SpaceX. The agency purchased 1,333 terminals, while SpaceX donated 3,667 terminals and the internet service itself. Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov had asked for SpaceX's help with internet services after Russia's invasion.

115.title: Man wanted in 11 cases arrested after gunfight in UP’s Bulandshahr
115.article_body: A man, wanted in 11 cases, was arrested on Wednesday following a gunfight with police in UP's Bulandshahr, officials said. The accused sustained bullet injury in retaliatory firing by the police and was taken to hospital. His accomplice was also arrested a few hours later, police added. They were allegedly apprehended while trying to rob a businessman.

116.title: Businessman sets 25-yr-old son on fire in broad daylight in B'luru; act caught on CCTV
116.article_body: A businessman in Bengaluru killed his 25-year-old son by setting him on fire in broad daylight after pouring thinner on him. A CCTV footage of the incident shows the victim running on a street in pain after being set ablaze. The accused took the step reported after his son failed to give account details of ₹1.5 crore.

117.title: You've to do remake with respect for original film: Shahid on Jersey
117.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about remaking 'Jersey' in Bollywood, said, "You have to make it original...you have to make it yours and you have to do it with a lot of respect for the original film." However, he added keeping all the important things from the original film is difficult. Shahid's film is a remake of the Telugu film 'Jersey'.

118.title: Pic shows leg of dinosaur 'killed on same day' a giant asteroid hit Earth
118.article_body: A preserved leg of a dinosaur thought to have been killed on the day a giant asteroid slammed into Earth, wiping them out, has been found. The limb, complete with skin, was found at the Tanis fossil site in North Dakota, reported BBC. It is widely accepted that a roughly 12 km-wide asteroid hit our planet 66 million years ago.

119.title: Get on the right side of history: Ukraine to Hungary over Russia
119.article_body: Ukraine has accused Hungary of destroying the unity of the European Union over Russia's invasion after Budapest said it was prepared to pay in rubles for Russian gas. "If Hungary...wants to help end...war...[it should] not create additional sources of funding for Russia's military machine. It's never too late to get on the right side of history," Ukraine Foreign Ministry said.

120.title: LSG are looking like the team to beat in IPL 2022: Morne Morkel
120.article_body: Ex-SA pacer Morne Morkel has said LSG are looking like the team to beat in the ongoing IPL season. "It was a fantastic effort from LSG to defend their 170-run target against SRH...they've three fantastic bowlers to bowl at the back end...[Avesh Khan, Andrew Tye and Jason Holder]," stated Morkel. LSG will play their fourth game against DC on Thursday.

121.title: 2,200 Indian Sikh pilgrims given visas to attend Baisakhi: Pakistan
121.article_body: Pakistan has issued visas to 2,200 Sikh pilgrims from India for attending Baisakhi celebrations from April 12 to 21, said the country's embassy. "During their visit to Pakistan, the pilgrims would…go to Panja Sahib, Nankana Sahib and Kartarpur Sahib," it added. It further said that visas have been issued to Sikh pilgrims from other countries as well.

122.title: One kid dies, another suffers injuries after stray dogs attack them in UP
122.article_body: While one kid died, another suffered serious injuries after stray dogs attacked two minors, playing outside their house near the Thakurganj police station area of Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Wednesday night. "The matter is being investigated and such stray dogs are being identified from the places wherever they are," the Municipal Commissioner said, addressing the issue of catching stray dogs.

123.title: India at par with world in disaster management: Amit Shah
123.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said India has increased its stature in disaster management. Now its capacity is at par with many other countries in the world and ahead of them on various occasions, Shah added. "We have travelled a long way in disaster management...Now we are able to get information much before any disaster," Shah stated.

124.title: 3 gangsters arrested for lifting ATM containing ₹34 lakh in Delhi
124.article_body: Three members of a Mewat-based gang were arrested for allegedly lifting ATMs in Delhi-NCR and lifting an ATM containing ₹34 lakh from Delhi's Badarpur, police said on Thursday. An ATM of a nationalised bank containing ₹34 lakh was found removed in Badarpur on March 31, police said. The suspects were identified with the help of CCTV footage, police added.

125.title: Pune man loses ₹17 lakh of deceased father's savings in search of job
125.article_body: A 27-year-old man in Pune was allegedly cheated of ₹17.38 lakh by cyber fraudsters on pretext of employment in escort services, police said. According to FIR, the victim had applied for the job online and was asked to make multiple money transfers on account of 'license fees', etc. The lost amount came from savings of victim's deceased father, police added.

126.title: 15-yr-old French tennis player slaps opponent after losing match; video viral
126.article_body: A video of 15-year-old French tennis player Michael Kouame slapping his Ghanian opponent Raphael Nii Ankrah after losing a match has gone viral. The incident took place during an ITF Juniors tournament in Accra, Ghana. Kouame later apologised for his actions and said, "During the match, I was verbally abused by the crowd, including insults to my mother in particular."

127.title: Edtech unicorn Unacademy lays off 1,000 employees: Report
127.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech unicorn Unacademy has laid off around 1,000 employees in the past few weeks as part of a cost-cutting exercise, ET reported citing sources. An Unacademy spokesperson said, "A small subset of employee, contractor and educator roles were re-evaluated due to role redundancy and performance." Unacademy was last valued at $3.4 billion in a funding round in August 2021.

128.title: A big thank you to the audience for accepting 'Attack': John Abraham
128.article_body: After the release of his film 'Attack', John Abraham took to Instagram and wrote, "Whatever appreciation we have received...a big THANK YOU to the audience for accepting something...new and different." John added 'Attack' was an "honest" and "humble" experiment to give the film industry something refreshing. "It was challenging through...three pandemic waves but we got what we wanted," he wrote.

129.title: US probes Amazon's handling of staffs' use of sellers' data: WSJ
129.article_body: The US SEC is probing how Amazon handled its staff's disclosures on use of third-party sellers' data allegedly to boost its own private-label business, The Wall Street Journal reported. The emails and communications from several senior Amazon executives have been asked for by the government. Amazon had earlier launched an internal investigation to see whether its employees used sellers' data.

130.title: Why did we elect govt?: SC on PIL seeking to deport Rohingya-Bangladeshi infiltrators
130.article_body: The Supreme Court rejected a plea seeking to "detect, detain and deport illegal Rohingya and Bangladeshi infiltrators from West Bengal within one year" and said that the government is the right authority to examine such issues. "These are political issues...If we have to take up all your PILs, then why did we elect the government?" the CJI said.

131.title: India to face significant consequences: US on India aligning with Russia
131.article_body: White House Director of the National Economic Council, Brian Deese, has said the US has told India that the consequences of a "more explicit strategic alignment" with Russia would be "significant and long-term". "There are certainly areas where we have been disappointed by both China and India's decisions, in the context of the Russian invasion," he added.

132.title: We've destroyed fuel storage facilities in 4 Ukrainian cities: Russia
132.article_body: Russia said its missiles destroyed four fuel storage facilities in the Ukrainian cities of Mykolaiv, Kharkiv, Zaporizhzhia, and Chuhuiv overnight. The fuel facilities were used by Ukraine to supply its troops near the cities of Mykolaiv and Kharkiv and in the eastern Donbas region, the Russian Defence Ministry said. "Operational-tactical aviation also hit 29 military assets of Ukraine," it added.

133.title: English footballer kisses teammate for scoring in injury time, pic goes viral
133.article_body: Wrexham forward Ollie Palmer kissed his teammate Paul Mullin after the latter scored in the injury time of their FA Trophy semi-final match against Stockport. Wrexham shared a picture of the celebration on Instagram, writing, "Sealed with a kiss." Mullin also scored another goal in the injury time to help his team win 2-0.

134.title: Krafton bans 66,233 Battlegrounds Mobile India users for cheating
134.article_body: Battlegrounds Mobile India (BGMI) developer Krafton said it banned 66,233 accounts between March 28 and April 3 for cheating. A list of names of the banned accounts has also been published by Krafton. The company has banned a total of 1,22,766 BGMI accounts since March 6. Unlike before, Krafton now shuts out both the account and the device simultaneously.

135.title: We're getting morning gift in form of fuel price hike: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
135.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury while commenting on the increased fuel prices in the country, said, "Everyday we're getting a morning gift in form of a fuel price hike." Chowdhury further said that the government is citing the Russia-Ukraine crisis as an excuse for price hike. Notably, prices of petrol and diesel were hiked for the 14th time on Wednesday.

136.title: I want to learn to play those one-handed shots from Pant: David Warner
136.article_body: Australia batter David Warner, who's likely to play his first game for DC against LSG, has said he's excited to bat with Rishabh Pant. Warner added, "I want to see how I can learn to play those one-handed shots." He further said, "Ricky Ponting has had a fair bit of success with DC...I am looking forward to working with him."

137.title: Threatened by bulldozer, 5 gang-rape accused surrender in UP
137.article_body: Five out of six men who were accused of gang-raping a minor last month surrendered themselves on Thursday morning after police threatened them with a bulldozer in UP. Ambedkarnagar Police said one accused was arrested on Wednesday but the remaining were absconding. Thereafter, police took a bulldozer to their village and made an announcement, asking them to surrender.

138.title: Raj Congress holds protest against central govt over rising inflation
138.article_body: Rajasthan unit of Congress on Thursday staged a protest in Jaipur against the central government over rising inflation in the country. "People across the country are perturbed by inflation. They are committing suicide due to joblessness and inflation," State Cabinet Minister Pratap Singh Khachariyawas said. The protest came following a constant rise in fuel prices across the country.

139.title: Remember fighting with parents for not letting me watch 'Kuch Kuch..': Srinidhi
139.article_body: Kannada actress Srinidhi Shetty said that she remembers that she fought with her parents for not letting her watch Shah Rukh Khan, Rani Mukerji and Kajol starrer 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai' because she was young. "I remember watching Hindi movies while travelling...from Mangalore to Mumbai in buses...I always wanted to be on the other side of the screen," she added.

140.title: Govt should consider financial impact while launching welfare schemes: SC
140.article_body: Supreme Court has said that the government should consider the financial impact when coming up with welfare schemes. It referred to the Right to Education Act and added that a right has been created but "where are the schools?". SC was hearing a plea over adequate infrastructure to provide effective legal aid to women abused in matrimonial homes.

141.title: 3 green corridors created in a day in B'luru to transport live organs
141.article_body: In a first, three zero-traffic green corridors were created on a single day to transport vital organs from different hospitals in Bengaluru on Wednesday, authorities from Jeevasarthakathe, the State Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation, said. Notably, one corridor was created to transport a liver, the second was created to transport a heart and the third one to transport the lungs.

142.title: Glad we don't have to bowl to Babar Azam any more: Aaron Finch
142.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch said he was glad that his team didn't have to bowl to Babar Azam any more, following the conclusion of Australia's tour of Pakistan. Babar scored 276 runs in three ODIs and 390 runs in the three Test matches. He scored 66 off 46 balls at a strike rate of 143.47 in the only T20I.

143.title: Pic of Tharoor & Supriya Sule chatting during a speech in LS goes viral; sparks memes
143.article_body: Video and picture of Congress MP Shashi Tharoor and NCP MP Supriya Sule chatting during former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah's speech in the Lok Sabha have gone viral on social media. "Shashi Tharoor teaching us that work life balance is important," a twitter user wrote with the picture. "That admiring look," wrote another.

144.title: Superstardom is waking up at 5 am, working through the day: Ram Charan
144.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said superstardom for him is waking up at 5 am, giving the first shot for the day's shooting at 7.30 am and working through the day. "Discipline will make you a good human," added Ram. Ram recently starred in the film 'RRR' with the movie's director SS Rajamouli terming his introduction sequence one of the scariest shots.

145.title: US-based Coinbase plans to more than triple staff strength in India
145.article_body: US-based cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase plans to more than triple its number of employees in India this year to around 1,000, CEO Brian Armstrong said. "We are going to invest for the long term in India,"  Armstrong said at a Coinbase conference in Bengaluru. Coinbase is also allowing customers to use UPI to directly purchase cryptocurrencies on the exchange.

146.title: We condemn Al-Qaeda, K'taka HM's statements on hijab row: Congress
146.article_body: Congress General Secretary Ajay Maken on Thursday said the party condemns the statement of Al-Qaeda on the hijab row. "It's a banned terrorist organisation that has no business commenting on internal affairs of India," Maken said. He added that Congress also condemns the statement by Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra as both he and Al-Qaeda are polarising the country's atmosphere.

147.title: Centre's real strength is its 'weapons of mass distraction': Tharoor on fuel price
147.article_body: Soon after LS passed a Bill on Weapons of Mass Destruction, Congress' Shashi Tharoor said, Centre's real strength is its "weapons of mass distraction". "Aided and abetted by complicit media, pointless controversies over halal, hijab and azaan have driven away focus from price rise," he tweeted. "It's clear that GOI doesn't want to discuss prices at any price!" he said.

148.title: Karnataka CM to inaugurate 'SARAS' fair in Bengaluru tomorrow
148.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai will inaugurate 'Sanjeevini SARAS-2022', a national fair of Self-Help Group women on Friday in Bengaluru, State Minister CN Ashwathnarayan said. About 700 women entrepreneurs from across the country will participate in the fair to showcase their skills and sell the products, which include handlooms, handicrafts, etc. About 310 stalls will be on display at the fair.

149.title: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Kuleba appeals to NATO to send more arms
149.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has urged NATO to provide more weapons to the country amid the ongoing Russian invasion. "We know how to win. But without sustainable and sufficient supplies...these wins will be accompanied by enormous sacrifices," Kuleba added. Ukraine's request comes amid reports of Russia regrouping its troops in eastern regions of Ukraine, after retreating from Kyiv.

150.title: CPI(M) facing most challenging times since formation in 1964: Party report
150.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) is facing its most challenging times since its formation in 1964, CPI(M) organisational report said. "The strong bases of West Bengal and Tripura are under severe attack...there has been an erosion in the party's mass...influence," it added. "CPI(M), as well as Left, have to fight against the consolidated RSS-BJP regime," the report stated.

151.title: Delhi labourer uploads morphed pics of 150 women, blackmails them to have sex
151.article_body: A labourer in Delhi has been arrested for allegedly posting morphed pictures of around 150 women online and blackmailing them to have sex with him, police said. The 30-year-old learned stalking and blackmailing women through YouTube, police added. The man said that he would download women's display pictures on social media and morph their faces with nudes downloaded from internet.

152.title: Sri Lankan Prez appoints expert team to deal with economic crisis
152.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has appointed a team of experts to deal with the ongoing economic crisis in the country. The members reportedly include former Governor of the country's central bank, former World Bank Chief Economist and former Deputy Director of the International Monetary Fund. The members had discussions with the President on key matters, said a government note.

153.title: Can’t be better tribute to Rishi, 2 actors in same role never seen: Satish
153.article_body: Discussing late actor Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen', actor Satish Kaushik said there can't be a better tribute to Rishi ji. "I remember while giving the last shot of the film, Rishi ji said he couldn't [have] given a better shot," added Satish. "There are two actors...playing the same role. It's...never happened in the history of cinema," stated Satish.

154.title: You are the real Raja Hindustani now, loved all over India: Aamir to Rajamouli
154.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that filmmaker SS Rajamouli is the "real Raja Hindustani" as he is now loved all over India. "I am hearing all good things about it and I feel people cannot stop gushing about 'RRR'. Every time someone praises the film, I call Rajamouli ji and I can hear the happiness in his voice," Aamir added.

155.title: Flight services at Bagdogra airport suspended temporarily due to runway damage
155.article_body: Flight operations at Bagdogra International Airport in West Bengal's Siliguri were temporarily suspended from 7 am on Thursday due to damage on the runway. Many passengers were stuck at the airport due to the sudden closure of flight operations. Airlines tweeted requesting their passengers to keep a check on their flight status following the crisis.

156.title: Hyd International Airport to inaugurate 1st phase of expanded terminal soon
156.article_body: The first phase of expansion work at Hyderabad International Airport will be completed soon and the new area will be open to the public. The expansion work was undertaken to cater to the rising demand in air passenger traffic. Now, the airport will be bigger and include the construction of an additional built-up area, GMR Hyderabad International Airport Limited said.

157.title: Turkey halts journalist Khashoggi trial, transfers it to S Arabia
157.article_body: A Turkish court has decided to halt the trial in absentia of 26 Saudi suspects over the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi and transfer it to Saudi Arabia. The move comes despite warnings from human rights groups that turning the case over to the kingdom would lead to a cover-up. Khashoggi was killed inside Saudi consulate in Istanbul in 2018.

158.title: 18-year-old Baby AB's no-look six against KKR goes viral
158.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, slammed a no-look six against KKR on his IPL debut on Wednesday. Brevis slammed the six on a 91.1-kmph delivery bowled by KKR spinner Varun Chakaravarthy on the first ball of MI's eighth over. Brevis sent the ball over a distance of 81 metres.

159.title: Delhi's Ambedkar University to hold all UG admissions through CUET
159.article_body: The Ambedkar University Delhi (AUD) will hold its undergraduate admissions for the academic session 2022-23 through the Common University Entrance Test (CUET), Vice-Chancellor Anu Singh Lather said on Thursday. AUD officials said that the students would first need to register on the National Testing Agency (NTA) website and on the AUD website once the CUET scores come out.

160.title: LSG are getting momentum, they are ahead of DC: Kaif
160.article_body: Talking about DC-LSG match, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif has said KL Rahul-led LSG are "five per cent ahead" of Rishabh Pant-led DC. "LSG are getting momentum...they won [against CSK] because of their batting...[and] their last game [against SRH] due to their bowling," he added. Kaif, however, also said DC know how to make a comeback after a loss.

161.title: RAF jawan arrested for killing his 3-yr-old daughter in Navi Mumbai
161.article_body: A 39-year-old jawan attached to the Rapid Action Force (RAF) has been arrested in Navi Mumbai for allegedly murdering his three-year-old daughter on April 5 by hitting her head and stomach. Police said he had a quarrel with his wife, following which he assaulted her and their daughter. He later dumped the child's body in an open space in Taloja.

162.title: CBI submits Birbhum violence probe report to Calcutta HC
162.article_body: The CBI on Thursday submitted its initial report on the investigation into West Bengal's Birbhum violence to the Calcutta High Court. As many as nine people were killed in the violence following the killing of a TMC leader in the area. According to Indian Express sources, the report says that a large part of the evidence has been destroyed.

163.title: Bollywood lyricist Maya Govind passes away at 82, son reveals she had blood clot in brain
163.article_body: Veteran lyricist Maya Govind passed away on Thursday aged 82 at her residence in Mumbai. "She died in her sleep at home this morning...She had blood clots in...brain and had other health issues like urine infection," her son Ajay stated. Some of her famous works are songs in films like 'Aarop', 'Daman' and 'Main Khiladi Tu Anari', among others.

164.title: Meta working on digital money, employees name it 'Zuck Bucks': Report
164.article_body: Facebook and Instagram's parent company Meta is exploring the potential of digital money and employees are internally calling it "Zuck Bucks", a play on Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's name, The Financial Times reported. Zuck Bucks is "unlikely" to be a cryptocurrency, the report said. "Instead, Meta is leaning towards introducing in-app tokens centrally controlled by the company," it added.

165.title: Rajya Sabha misses 100% productivity in Budget Session by just 10 minutes
165.article_body: The Rajya Sabha clocked 99.80% productivity during the Budget Session that concluded on Thursday, PTI reported on Thursday quoting officials. It added that the Rajya Sabha missed the 100% landmark just by 10 minutes. This is the Upper House's third-best productive session in the last 14 sessions since the Monsoon Session (243rd Session) of 2017, the Rajya Sabha officials said.

166.title: They have a lot of money, will justify it: Akhtar on MI's losing streak
166.article_body: Reacting to MI losing their third consecutive IPL 2022 match against KKR, ex-KKR pacer Shoaib Akhtar said MI have a lot of money and will do something to justify it. "At some stages, it has appeared that they are out of the tournament altogether, but have gone on to turn things around and win it as well," added Akhtar.

167.title: Mob lynchings happen if we wear skull caps, carry beard: Muslim body
167.article_body: Amid ongoing debate around Azaan and halal meat, Haji Mohammed Salees of Sunni Ulema Council said, "There's a problem if we wear skull caps, carry a beard, or wear a hijab, mob lynchings are happening. They have an eye on what we eat as well." He added Azaan gets completed in 2-3 minutes but there is problem with that too.

168.title: Conman poses as ACB official, asks B'luru engineer to pay ₹1.44 lakh to avoid raid
168.article_body: An unidentified conman allegedly posed as an ACB official and targeted a superintendent engineer of Bangalore Electricity Supply Company and threatened to raid his house. "The conman told Shanthamallappa to apply for leave on a particular day to coordinate with the raid and also gave him an option to transfer ₹1.44 lakh to stop the raid," the police said.

169.title: Will take strong measures if US House Speaker visits Taiwan: China
169.article_body: China has warned that it would take strong measures if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan. This comes after media reports suggested that Pelosi would visit China-claimed Taiwan next week. The visit would severely impact China-US relations, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zhao Lijian said, adding that Beijing opposes all forms of official interactions between the US and Taiwan.

170.title: Sleep separately, don't kiss or hug: COVID-hit Shanghai's officials warn residents
170.article_body: Amid a lockdown in China's Shanghai, residents have shared videos on social media showing health workers making public announcements using megaphones. "From tonight, couples should sleep separately, don't kiss, hug is not allowed and eat separately," workers were seen as saying. Another video showed a drone announcing, "Control your soul's desire for freedom. Do not open the window or sing."

171.title: BJP fears defeat in Himachal, wants Anurag Thakur as CM face: Sisodia
171.article_body: Ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia claimed on Thursday that BJP wants to make Union Minister Anurag Thakur its chief ministerial face. Sisodia alleged that BJP fears defeat in state and is wary of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal's "popularity". CM Jairam Thakur has done nothing for the state's residents, Sisodia added.

172.title: Maha Deputy CM urges Centre to reconsider raising CNG & PNG prices
172.article_body: Centre imposes more tax on natural gas than state government and it should reconsider this, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. In Mumbai, CNG and PNG prices increased by ₹7 and ₹5 to settle at ₹67/kg and ₹41/standard m³ respectively on Wednesday. "I do not want to impose more taxes. Rather, [Maharashtra government] reduced tax on gas," Pawar added.

173.title: Sidhu meets family of kabaddi player Dharminder who was shot dead in Patiala
173.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Thursday met the family members of the deceased kabaddi player Dharminder Singh in Patiala. "If the police are unable to arrest the accused within three days then we’ll take necessary action," Sidhu said. Dharminder was shot dead after a clash in front of Punjabi University in Patiala on Tuesday night.

174.title: Congress workers protest against fuel price hike in J&K's Srinagar
174.article_body: Congress workers on Thursday staged a protest against the fuel price hike in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir.
