"We have organised such protests across the country," a Congress worker said. "They (BJP-led Centre) decreased the prices before polls and increased soon after polls got over. Poor is the worst affected," the Congress worker added.

175.title: You ain't seen nothing yet: Rohit Sharma after MI lose 3 matches in a row
175.article_body: After their third defeat in a row in IPL 2022, MI captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to share a picture from the match against KKR and wrote, "We stick together through thick and thin and that's just one of our strengths." He added, "You ain't seen nothing yet." KKR handed MI their third straight defeat on Wednesday.

176.title: Delhi's maximum temperature likely to reach 43°C by weekend
176.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Delhi is likely to intensify and the maximum temperature may reach 43°C by this weekend, the India Meteorological Department said. The maximum temperature in the city is predicted to reach 40°C on Thursday. The heatwave conditions are predicted from Thursday till April 13.

177.title: Makeup artist identifies dead body by her red & white manicure in Ukraine; pic surfaces
177.article_body: A makeup artist recognised the dead body of a woman she knew with the help of her manicure in Ukraine's Bucha. A picture, which is being widely circulated, showed her dirt-covered hand with red and white polish on her nails. Bodies of several people were seen lying on streets of Bucha after the town was recaptured by Ukrainian troops.

178.title: Google Play to block downloads for outdated apps starting Nov 1
178.article_body: Google Play will hide outdated apps and block their installation starting November 1. Google said apps that don't target an Android API within two years of the latest major Android release version will no longer be able to be discovered or installed by new users whose devices run Android OS versions that are higher than the apps' target API level.

179.title: Mumbai Police's ban on construction at night put on hold till May 31
179.article_body: The Mumbai Police has been asked to put its order, banning construction after 10 pm on hold till May 31. At a review meeting with CM Uddhav Thackeray, BMC chief Iqbal Singh Chahal requested the state government to put such restrictions on hold as it was affecting the disposal of debris from the sites ahead of the monsoon season.

180.title: Omar Abdullah questioned by ED in J&K Bank scam case
180.article_body: ED on Thursday questioned former J&K CM Omar Abdullah in connection with the J&K money laundering case in Delhi. Criticising the move, his party JKNC said, "Even though this exercise is political in nature he will cooperate as there is no wrongdoing on his part." It added that Abdullah didn't seek a postponement despite this being the month of Ramzan.

181.title: Vital to go through pain, humiliation: Rajamouli on 'RRR' action scenes
181.article_body: Discussing the creation of action sequences in his movie 'RRR', director SS Rajamouli said it is important to go through the emotions of pain and humiliation if you want to attract the heart of the audience. "SS Rajamouli is the biggest filmmaker that India has probably ever seen. This maverick filmmaker cannot be real," Karan Johar had earlier stated.

182.title: Being a foodie is my roadblock, I gain 5-10 kgs in a month but I don't cry: Aly
182.article_body: Actor Aly Goni said that him being a foodie acts like a roadblock for him. "My body is...such that I can gain 5-10 kgs in a month...but I don't sit and cry about it...instead...I work on it," the actor said. He added, "I know when I need to lose weight...I don't let anything come in the way."

183.title: There were times I didn't feel protected: Alicia on filming sex scenes
183.article_body: Talking about filming sex scenes, Oscar-winning actress Alicia Vikander said she has been in situations that were not fine, adding that she didn't feel protected. "[There was an instance where] everyone was busy doing their own thing and...[I was sitting] naked for a couple of hours," added Alicia. "It's the worst thing ever to do those scenes," stated Alicia.

184.title: Faf du Plessis has got the respect of everyone in RCB: Maxwell
184.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell, who's likely to be available for their next game, has said captain Faf du Plessis has got the respect of everyone in the franchise. "Not only does he lead by example...but he also performs really well," stated Maxwell. "What I've been really excited about has been one of the old fellows, Dinesh Karthik," he further said.

185.title: Mother can't be denied child's custody if she doesn't fit the mould: HC
185.article_body: A mother cannot be denied her child's custody if she does not fit the mould, Chhattisgarh HC said. HC set aside a family court's order granting custody of a child to the father. A certificate by society's few members with an "ostrich mindset" should not be allowed to decide a woman's character, the HC ruled.

186.title: UP govt hands over Ayodhya airport land to Airports Authority of India
186.article_body: The Civil Aviation Department of Uttar Pradesh transferred the land purchased for construction of Maryada Purushottam Shri Ram International Airport at Ayodhya to the Airports Authority of India (AAI) today. The state government purchased 317.855 acres of land for the construction of an international airport at Ayodhya. The land was given on lease in presence of UP CM Yogi Adityanath.

187.title: Ex-Amnesty chief seeks ₹3.8 lakh from CBI officer after being denied US flight
187.article_body: A day after former Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel was stopped from flying to US, he demanded that the CBI investigating officer who issued a lookout circular against him must compensate for his flight tickets. "The officer must pay ₹3.8 lakh from his salary," Patel's lawyer told a Delhi court, asking for "a suitable reply" to the law enforcement agencies.

188.title: Enrolment in govt schools rose 'significantly' post pandemic: Mizoram Min
188.article_body: Student enrolment in Mizoram government schools increased 'significantly' post the COVID-19 pandemic, state Education Minister Lalchhandama Ralte said. "State government has taken several steps to improve the education system and recruit more teachers," he said, adding, it prompted more parents to send their children to government schools. Notably, schools reopened in Mizoram on Tuesday.

189.title: Pre-term baby overcomes cardiac issues, brain haemorrhage at Delhi hospital
189.article_body: A pre-term baby weighing 704 grams overcame multiple infections, cardiac issues and brain haemorrhage at Fortis Hospital in Delhi's Vasant Kunj. The baby underwent 12 blood transfusions and was under intricate treatment and care for 115 days before getting discharged. A woman had given birth to twins through in-vitro fertilization, one of whom died soon after the birth.

190.title: Delhi's peak electricity demand rises to 'highest-ever' level in March
190.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand increased to its highest-ever level of 4,648 megawatts (MW) in March 2022, the Delhi DISCOMs said. Reportedly, Delhi's peak electricity demand in March was 25% more as compared to the corresponding period of 2021. According to IMD data, India recorded its warmest March in 122 years, while Delhi's highest maximum temperature in March was 39.6°C.

191.title: Women in Ukraine cutting off hair to be 'less attractive' to Russian troops to avoid rape
191.article_body: Ukrainian women are cutting off their hair in an attempt to stop Russian troops from raping them, according to a town's deputy mayor. "Girls started cutting their hair short to be less attractive, so no one looks at them anymore," said Maryna Beschastna, ITV reported. "In one village, two sisters were raped...girls of 15 and 16...children," she stated.

192.title: Give me Babar, Virat and 9 pieces of wood, I'll win you WC: Ex-Pak captain Latif
192.article_body: Praising Virat Kohli and Babar Azam, former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said, "Give me Babar, Virat and nine pieces of wood, I will win you the World Cup." Latif referenced former Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson, who had once said, "Give me 10 pieces of wood and Zinedine Zidane and I'll win the Champions League."

193.title: Krunal Pandya is like my brother and brothers do fight: Deepak Hooda on their spat
193.article_body: Referring to his spat with Krunal Pandya which led to him leaving Baroda team last year, Deepak Hooda said that Krunal, who's his LSG teammate now, is like his brother. "Brothers do fight. We're playing with one aim, which is to win games for LSG," he said. Earlier, their picture went viral, which showed them hugging while celebrating a wicket.

194.title: Got to get out before I slap someone, jokes Jim Carrey on retirement
194.article_body: Actor-comedian Jim Carrey, who will retire from acting after 'Sonic the Hedgehog 2', jokingly said he wants to get out before he slaps someone, in an apparent reference to Will Smith slapping Chris Rock. Smith slapped Chris at the 2022 Oscars, with Carrey saying he would have sued Smith for $200 million. Smith has resigned from the Oscars Academy.

195.title: 161 died due to accidents during hazardous cleaning of sewers in 3 yrs: Govt
195.article_body: The Centre told the Parliament that 161 people died in accidents while undertaking hazardous cleaning of septic tanks and sewers in the last three years. However, there was no report of deaths due to manual scavenging, Social Justice Minister Virendra Kumar stated. He added that 118 such deaths were reported in 2019, 19 in 2020 and 24 in 2021.

196.title: PMPML to launch electric-cab facility with affordable rates in Pune
196.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Ltd (PMPML) has said that it is planning to launch an electric-cab service in the city. "There is...a need to provide service to passengers for last-mile connectivity...PMPML plans to overcome this gap through e-car service," PMPML Chairman and Managing Director Laxminarayan Mishra said. The service would be provided at affordable rates, he added.

197.title: World's 'skinniest' skyscraper opens in US with apartments starting from ₹59 crore
197.article_body: 'Steinway Tower', which developers claim is "the most slender skyscraper in the world", is now welcoming its first residents. The 1,428 ft tower, with a width to height ratio of 1:24, includes 60 apartments spanning 84 floors. The apartments range from $7.75 million (around ₹59 crore) for a studio apartment to $66 million (over ₹500 crore) for a penthouse.

198.title: UFOs had sexual encounters with humans, left woman pregnant: Secret US govt docs
198.article_body: UFOs had sexual encounters with humans and even left one woman pregnant, according to US Defence Department documents obtained by The Sun from Defence Intelligence Agency as part of a Freedom of Information request. The report – titled Anomalous Acute And Subacute Field Effects on Human and Biological Tissues – investigates injuries to "human observers by anomalous advanced aerospace systems".

199.title: Rare ancient cemetery of flying reptiles found in Chile: Scientists
199.article_body: Scientists claim to have unearthed a rare cemetery of ancient flying reptiles that roamed the Atacama desert in Chile more than 100 million years ago. The well-preserved remains belong to pterosaurs that had a long wingspan. "Most pterosaur bones that are found are...broken...We were able to recover preserved three-dimensional bones," Chile Museum of National History's David Rubilar said.

200.title: Gold worth over ₹24 lakh seized from man's trouser & underwear at Hyd airport
200.article_body: The Hyderabad Customs has detected and seized 478.520 gram of gold valued at ₹24.820 lakh from a male passenger at the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. He had concealed the gold inside his trouser and underwear, Customs officials said. The passenger arrived by Emirates flight EK526 from Dubai, they added.

201.title: India our big brother, grateful to PM Modi: Sri Lanka's Jayasuriya amid economic crisis
201.article_body: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Sanath Jayasuriya praised India over its help to Sri Lanka amid economic crisis, saying, "As a neighbour and a big brother of our country, India has always helped us." "We're grateful to the Indian government and PM Modi," he added. India has supplied over 270,000 MT fuel to Sri Lanka to help ease the power crisis.

202.title: Twitter's next board meeting is gonna be lit: Musk on pic of himself smoking joint
202.article_body: Elon Musk on Thursday took to Twitter to share a meme that featured a picture of him smoking a joint during a podcast. The meme read, "Twitter's next board meeting is gonna be lit." Musk, who's the biggest shareholder of Twitter with a 9.1% stake in the company, has been appointed to the company's board.

203.title: 2 men enter Pune girl's house, molest her; burn her hand after resistance
203.article_body: Two men allegedly molested an 18-year-old girl after barging into her house in Pune. Police said that the accused also burned her hand with a hot frying skimmer when she tried to resist them. The men entered the girl's house saying that they wanted a water can kept inside the house. The victim reportedly lodged an FIR on Thursday morning.

204.title: BSF seizes arms, ammunition from Akhnoor International Border in Jammu
204.article_body: In a special operation, the Border Security Force (BSF) of Jammu seized a bag containing arms and ammunition at Akhnoor International Border on Thursday. The consignment was planned to be smuggled into India from Pakistan, BSF said. "BSF...recovered one AK-47 rifle, 20 AK-47 RDS, two rifle magazines, two pistols, 40 pistol RDS, and four pistol magazines," the official statement read.

205.title: Former Haryana Congress leader Nirmal Singh, daughter Chitra join AAP
205.article_body: Former Haryana Congress leader Nirmal Singh Mohra and his daughter Chitra Sarwara on Thursday joined Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in presence of Arvind Kejriwal. "This will definitely strengthen the party," AAP leader Sushil Gupta tweeted. Singh was a two-time minister in the Haryana government and a four-time MLA from the Naggal Assembly constituency. Notably, Singh had founded Haryana Democratic Front.

206.title: Police open fire, arrest 2 for robbing, sexually abusing man in B'luru
206.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Tuesday shot two men, Mohammed Ashik and Issac, in the leg before arresting them for robbing and sexually abusing a male student last month. On March 26, Ashik and Issac along with two others kidnapped and robbed the student before forcing him to perform oral sex on them. The gang left for Udupi after the alleged crime.

207.title: Bike thief caught in Mumbai's Jogeshwari, 11 two-wheelers recovered
207.article_body: The Meghwadi Police arrested a 30-year-old man and his aide for allegedly stealing 11 bikes and a scooter from different areas of Mumbai and recovered the vehicles. The accused, who is resident of a chawl in Jogeshwari (East), had stolen six Bajaj Pulsar, one Honda Activa, one Honda Shine, one Yamaha R 15 and one Hero Honda, the police said.

208.title: Pollard must get a few more overs to bat with no Pandya brothers in MI: Aakash
208.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said all-rounder Kieron Pollard must get a few more overs to bat with no Pandya brothers in their side this season. In MI's match against KKR, Pollard scored 22* off five balls to help them post the 161-run total. In their previous two games, Pollard had scored 22 off 24 balls and three off six balls.

209.title: Selectors would be worried: Jaffer on Rohit Sharma's 12-ball 3 vs KKR
209.article_body: Reacting to MI captain Rohit Sharma scoring 54 runs in three IPL 2022 matches having been dismissed for 3 runs off 12 balls against KKR, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said the selectors would be worried about his form. "The rhythm is missing," added Jaffer. "This is a really weak MI bowling attack in spite of Jasprit Bumrah," stated Jaffer.

210.title: COVID-19 increases risk of blood clots for up to 6 months: Study
210.article_body: COVID-19 can increase the risk of serious blood clots for up to six months after infection, a new Sweden study suggested. Researchers from Umea University tracked the health of over one million people who had tested positive for COVID-19 between February 2020 and May 2021 in Sweden and compared them with more than four million people who didn't test positive.

211.title: Flipkart planning US listing in 2023 at $60-70 bn valuation: Report
211.article_body: Flipkart has pushed its IPO valuation target to around $60-70 billion, and is now planning a US listing in 2023 instead of 2022, Reuters reported citing sources. Some sources reportedly said that the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine played a part in Flipkart delaying its plans. Others said Flipkart's internal plan to boost valuations further caused the delay.

212.title: Minor among 2 arrested for stealing 26 vehicles in Ahmedabad
212.article_body: The Ahmedabad Police’s Detection of Crime Branch (DCB) arrested two persons, including a juvenile, for allegedly stealing around 26 autorickshaws and two-wheelers in the city. The accused were held near Naroda Patiya with a stolen autorickshaw. "We recovered 21 autorickshaws and five motorcycles which were stolen from different areas of Ahmedabad," DP Chudasma, ACP, DCB Ahmedabad, said.

213.title: Rana fined 10% of match fee, Bumrah also reprimanded for breaching IPL Code of Conduct
213.article_body: KKR's Nitish Rana has been reprimanded and fined 10% of his match fee for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during the MI-KKR match on Wednesday. MI's Jasprit Bumrah was also reprimanded but wasn't fined. Both the players admitted to the Level 1 offence of the code, IPL said. However, the IPL press release did not specify the breaches.

214.title: Plate put in ex-India cricketer Contractor's head after bouncer removed after 60 years
214.article_body: The metal plate inserted in ex-India batter Nari Contractor's head through surgery after he suffered a fracture following a bouncer by ex-West Indies pacer Charlie Griffith in 1962 has been removed. "The skin was disintegrating on the plate. So he had lost the skin covering it...hence it was advised by the doctors to get it removed," Contractor's son Hoshedar said.

215.title: 2 killed, 1 injured as cooking gas cylinder explodes in UP's Ballia
215.article_body: At least two people, aged 40 and 20, were killed and one was injured as a cooking gas cylinder exploded in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia, police said. The cylinder caught fire while they were cooking, police added. All the victims used to work at a petrol pump and were living together in rented accommodation, police further said.

216.title: Adani Group becomes 3rd Indian group to cross $200 billion in market value
216.article_body: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group has become India's third conglomerate to cross a market capitalisation of $200 billion. On Thursday, the group's market value stood at $201 billion as the shares of five of its seven listed firms hit all-time highs, according to BSE data. Earlier, Tata Group ($320 billion) and Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Group ($237 billion) achieved this milestone.

217.title: Akhilesh, SP sympathise with terrorists: Maurya on Gorakhnath temple attack
217.article_body: A day after Akhilesh Yadav accused BJP of exaggeration in the Gorakhnath temple attack case, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said, "Akhilesh Ji and SP have always been linked to terrorists." "I condemn his attempts to boost morale of terrorists," he added. "Our security personnel caught him by risking their lives...his statement is cheap and deplorable," he further said.

218.title: Hrithik and rumoured girlfriend Saba pose with Sussanne and her rumoured boyfriend
218.article_body: A picture of Hrithik Roshan and rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad posing with the actor's ex-wife Sussanne Khan and her rumoured boyfriend Arslan Goni has gone viral. The picture was shared by Sussanne on Instagram along with the caption, "The most precious blessing of life is to be relentlessly surrounded by the best energy."

219.title: Central government must take price rise seriously: Mayawati
219.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati on Thursday said central government must take the issue of price rise seriously. "People were already reeling under the stress of high inflation, unemployment and poverty when they were hit by...rise in prices of petrol, diesel, cooking gas and other essential items," she tweeted. Notably, fuel prices were hiked for the 14th time on Wednesday.

220.title: New cell discovered in human lungs that may treat respiratory disease
220.article_body: Scientists discovered a new type of cell named respiratory airway secretory cells (RASCs) in human lungs that could help in treating chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). These cells have a regenerative ability that could replenish other cells implicated in COPD, which facilitate normal functioning of alveoli. RASCs are found in tiny airway branches near alveoli air sacs in the lungs.

221.title: Auto driver who knocked down traffic police officer in Chennai held
221.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver, who knocked down a police officer during a vehicle-checking drive in Chennai, was arrested on Wednesday, three days after he went absconding. The driver, Sudharshan, had hit sub-inspector Pon Raj while he was engaged in a vehicle-checking drive on Mount Poonamallee Road. The police have now seized his vehicle and will soon take him into custody.

222.title: 1994 rape victim's son files complaint, DNA test exposes accused 28 yrs later
222.article_body: Police have identified two brothers as accused in 28-year-old rape case in Uttar Pradesh through a DNA test. Brothers had reportedly raped a woman, who was 12 years old then. The woman delivered baby boy but was forced to give him up. She met her son in 2020 who urged her to fight for justice and filed complaint against accused.

223.title: You may be a king, but if soldiers are weak, you'll lose: Kaif on MI's defeats
223.article_body: After MI lost their third straight game in the ongoing IPL season, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said, "You may be a big king, but if your soldiers are weak then you will lose the battle." He added, "The skill level of MI bowlers isn't that high this season...the team put together at the auction was not up to the mark."

224.title: I may be raided or booked: Bengaluru ex-police chief after joining AAP
224.article_body: Days after joining the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), former Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao said that raids may be conducted against him or cases may be registered. Rao added he is "ready to face them". "Our leader Arvind Kejriwal has done many sacrifices...faced many challenges. Whoever treads on the path of reform in society faces many...challenges," he further said.

225.title: Smoking during pregnancy may not cause ADHD in children: Study
225.article_body: A systematic review and meta-analysis of 46 prior studies showed though smoking during pregnancy is associated with offspring attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) it's unlikely to cause it. "Our...review shows...there's no causal effect between maternal prenatal smoking and offspring ADHD diagnosis. However, pregnant women should still...not...smoke," the lead author of the study said.

226.title: News article calls Musk's Twitter stake 'bad news' for free speech, he laughs
226.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk laughed in response to a Washington Post article that said his Twitter stake is "bad news" for free speech. "WaPo always good for a laugh," Musk said. Pointing to Musk's stake, Amazon's Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post had written, "When you're the world's richest human you can toss billions around like poker chips."

227.title: Heavy rains cause flash floods in Sydney, evacuation ordered
227.article_body: The Australian authorities asked thousands of people to evacuate their homes after torrential rain caused flash floods along the country's east coast. Sydney reportedly received a month's rain overnight leading to waterlogged streets, fallen power lines and uprooted trees. Sharp, short bursts of rain have been creating flash flooding almost every hour, said an emergency services official.

228.title: Delhi Police to integrate its licensing services with DigiLocker
228.article_body: Delhi Police will soon integrate its licensing unit with DigiLocker through National eGovernance Division (NeGD) in order to provide improved services to citizens. "The law enforcement agencies too will have an authentic source to verify such licenses," said OP Mishra, Joint Commissioner of Police (licensing). DCP Rakesh Asthana has also given his in-principle approval for the proposal, he added.

229.title: Constable, his brother shoot father, son dead over monetary dispute in UP
229.article_body: A constable and his brother allegedly held hostage, tortured and shot dead a 45-year-old man and his 20-year-old son over a monetary dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli, police said. The man had taken money from the constable on the pretext of providing a job, police added. Their bodies were later found in a tube well, police further said.

230.title: US sanctions on banks blow to ordinary citizens: Russia
230.article_body: US sanctions against Sberbank and Alfabank banks are a "direct blow to the Russian population [and] ordinary citizens", TASS news agency cited Russia's US Ambassador Anatoly Antonov as saying. Sberbank holds a third of Russia's total banking assets, while Alfabank is the fourth largest financial institution in the country. The sanctions were imposed in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

231.title: Meta cancels F8 developer event as it focuses on building metaverse
231.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has cancelled its annual developer conference 'F8' this year. "We are taking a brief break...while we gear up on new initiatives that are all tailored towards the next chapter of the internet...building the metaverse," the firm said. Meta added that it will still be holding its inaugural Conversations conference on May 19.

232.title: Ab nani yaad aayegi: Ashneer to BharatPe's CEO, Chairman on 'degrowth' quarter
232.article_body: Ashneer Grover, who recently quit from BharatPe, tweeted, "So I...heard BharatPe closed its first quarter of 'degrowth'...under able (sic) leadership of Rajnish Kumar (board Chairman) and Suhail Sameer (CEO)." "Ab nani (grandmother) yaad aayegi," he wrote. "Chaabi chheenna and hatti chalana do alag alag skills hai! (Snatching a key and running an elephant are two separate skills)," he added.

233.title: Yo Yo Honey Singh manhandled by 4-5 men at club in Delhi, says one man was armed
233.article_body: A complaint has been filed by singer Yo Yo Honey Singh against a group of four to five unidentified men after he was allegedly manhandled during his performance at a club in Delhi on March 27. Singh said that one of the men was armed. The men started misbehaving and disrupted the show, the complaint read.

234.title: Fox attacks US Congressman; Capitol Hill put on alert
234.article_body: The authorities sounded an alert after US Congressman Ami Bera was attacked by a fox while walking to the Capitol in Washington DC. Bera said he was attacked from behind by what he initially thought was a dog but turned out to be a fox. He fought the animal using his umbrella for about 15 seconds.

235.title: Rohit fans cool down: Virender Sehwag on being criticised over 'vada pav' tweet
235.article_body: After being criticised by Rohit Sharma fans over his tweet following MI's loss against KKR, Virender Sehwag urged them to cool down. "Moonh se nivala cheen liya...sorry vada pav cheen liya," Sehwag had tweeted while praising Pat Cummins for scoring 15-ball 56*. "Vada pav reference is for Mumbai...a city which thrives on vada pav. Rohit fans thanda lo," Sehwag clarified.

236.title: Over 12 maggots removed from man's eye in France; pic surfaces
236.article_body: Doctors in France reported a rare case of tiny sheep bot fly larvae, also known as maggots, infesting the outer surface of a man's eyeball. Doctors removed more than a dozen maggots from outside the eyeball and surrounding tissue, according to the report in The New England Journal of Medicine. Doctors had to pluck the maggots out using forceps.

237.title: Russian women film themselves cutting Chanel bags as brand stops selling to them
237.article_body: Several wealthy Russian women and influencers have been filming themselves cutting their Chanel bags with a pair of scissors after the brand pulled out of Russia and stopped selling to Russians abroad. "I am against Russophobia...If owning Chanel means selling my Motherland, then I don't need Chanel," TV presenter and actress Marina Ermoshkina said, cutting her bag.

238.title: Greater Noida increases land rates up to 25% in residential category
238.article_body: The Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) has increased the land allotment rates up to 25% which is between ₹5,000-₹7,000 per square metre for residential plots for FY 2022-23. The new rates per square metre of land will be ₹39,000 for category A, ₹36,000 for category B, ₹34,000 for category C and ₹29,000 for category D, the GNIDA said.

239.title: Over 80% kids with autism, cerebral palsy found depressed in Bihar
239.article_body: After check-ups held by Bihar health department organised in collaboration with NGOs, over 80% of the children with autism, cerebral palsy, and other disabilities have been found to be under stress and depression. "Majority of them had been going through mental stress because of confinement caused by...pandemic and lockdown. They need outdoor activities," founder of Special Olympics Bihar, said.

240.title: Rule of law supreme: Owaisi to T'gana govt after GHMC corporator's arrest
240.article_body: AIMIM chief and Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi criticised the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) and said that rule of law is supreme in Article 13 of the Constitution. This comes after one of his party's GHMC corporators, Mohammed Ghousuddin, was arrested for allegedly obstructing policemen. Owaisi was responding to a Hyderabad Police's tweet about a raid at a pub.

241.title: Intel India revs up growth & hiring to capture global opportunities
241.article_body: Intel is the only semiconductor company with the depth & breadth of intelligent silicon, software & hardware to fuel next-gen innovations. Holding this view, Intel commits to advancing its leadership by attracting the best talent. Intel India is offering competitive benefits like dual bonuses based on performance & profitability, restricted stock units for employees across all levels, and others.

242.title: LSG have too many bowling options, it can give headache to Rahul: Watson
242.article_body: DC's assistant coach Shane Watson has said LSG have too many bowling options and this could be a "big headache" for their captain KL Rahul. "It can be difficult to decide how you're going to give everyone a go...But at the moment, they have all the bases covered," he added. LSG played three all-rounders in their last game against SRH.

243.title: School teacher, her partner sexually assault teenagers in TN; arrested
243.article_body: A 45-year-old government school teacher and her 39-year-old partner have been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting three teenagers, including the woman's son aged 19, near Tamil Nadu's Madurai on Wednesday. "We came to know about it (the assault) after some of the photos and videos they shot were leaked and started circulating in the locality," police said.

244.title: Bitter pill to swallow: Shastri on MI's loss with 4 overs left vs KKR
244.article_body: Reacting to MI's defeat against KKR with four overs left having conceded 162 runs in 16 overs, Ravi Shastri said the loss is a bitter pill to swallow, adding that it was bizarre. "It's like...[being given] a chocolate and before you can say thank you, it's in the other guy's mouth and he's saying thank you," added Shastri.

245.title: Shaw has to improve execution, got out playing pull shot twice: Watson
245.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said Prithvi Shaw has to improve his execution of shots, adding that he has been dismissed playing the pull shot in both IPL 2022 matches played by the franchise. DC head coach Ricky Ponting had earlier said he will speak to Shaw about his dismissals. Shaw has scored 48 runs in two IPL 2022 matches.

246.title: Saw Baahubali 2 and thought 'Oh my god, how do you up that': Karan on Rajamouli
246.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said that he feels that filmmaker SS Rajamouli "cannot be real". "When I first saw 'Baahubali' I thought I had never seen something like that...Then I saw 'Baahubali 2' and I thought 'Oh my God! How do you up that?'. Then you see 'RRR' and you're like this is too good to be true," Karan added.

247.title: Criminal Procedure Bill violates dignity: P Chidambaram
247.article_body: Congress MP P Chidambaram has termed the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, 2022, as "unconstitutional". "It (the Bill) violates liberty, privacy and dignity of people. The Bill was not referred to a select committee," Chidambaram said on Wednesday while speaking in the Rajya Sabha during the second part of the Budget Session of Parliament.

248.title: Gautam Adani becomes world's 6th richest person: Forbes
248.article_body: India's richest man and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani has become the world's sixth richest person with a net worth of $116.6 billion, as per Forbes' real-time billionaires list. He surpassed Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison and Google's Founder Sergey Brin and Larry Page to reach the spot. Meanwhile, Reliance Industries' Chairman remained the world's 10th richest person, as per Forbes.

249.title: CAG flags flaws in project to build roads along Indo-Nepal border
249.article_body: A Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report pointed out several flaws in a project to build over 1,300 km of roads along the Indo-Nepal border. The report, which was tabled in Parliament, highlighted poor design, cost overruns and delays. The home ministry failed to ensure that land acquisition and forest clearances were taken in time, said the report.

250.title: Take care of WB, its debt almost equal to Sri Lanka: BJP to Mamata
250.article_body: Reacting to Mamata Banerjee's "India's financial condition worse than Sri Lanka" remark, BJP's Sukanta Majumdar said, "she should take care of her state as its debt is almost equal to Sri Lanka." "Sri Lanka's total debt was ₹6 lakh crore and Bengal's debt is ₹5.62 lakh crore. Had Bengal been a separate country, its condition would've been worse," Majumdar said.

251.title: No takers for KCR’s third front idea: Telangana BJP chief
251.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay has said that CM K Chandrashekar Rao's idea of a third front in national politics will not be accepted by other parties. "There are no takers for KCR's third front idea. He has no credibility among the other parties and nobody believes him," he said. Sanjay added that Rao treats his political adversaries with contempt.

252.title: AK-47 rifle, magazine seized from Agartala bound train in Assam
252.article_body: The Railway Protection Force and Government Railway Police recovered an AK-47 rifle and a magazine from an Agartala bound train in Assam's Hojai district. "When...security personnel asked a man sitting nearby about [a suspicious] bag, he said it is a blanket and...jumped off the train," an official said. Police have checked CCTV footage to trace the man, the official added.

253.title: CNG price hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi, to now cost ₹69.11 per kg
253.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in Delhi by ₹2.5 per kg from Thursday. CNG will now cost ₹69.11 per kg in the national capital after an increase by over ₹9 in six days. The CNG price in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad has been hiked to ₹71.67 per kg.

254.title: Kya kar loge: Amitabh Bachchan to trolls on promoting son Abhishek's film 'Dasvi'
254.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, in an apparent response to people trolling him for promoting his son Abhishek Bachchan's film 'Dasvi', tweeted, "Ji haan huzoor. Mai karta hu: Badhai, Prachar, Manglachar! Kya kar loge? (Yes sir, I do: congratulations, promotions, invocations!!! What will you do?)" Recently, Amitabh had praised the trailer of the film, which released today.

255.title: Ukraine can absolutely win war, Putin has achieved zero objectives: US
255.article_body: The US has said that Ukraine can "absolutely" win the war against Russia.  "And if you look at what they have been able to do just thus far, [Russian President] Vladimir Putin has achieved exactly zero of his strategic objectives inside Ukraine. He didn't take Kyiv...topple the government...[or] remove Ukraine as a nation-state," Pentagon Press Secretary John Kirby said.

256.title: Real Madrid beat Chelsea, Bayern suffer loss in Champions League last-8 1st leg
256.article_body: Real Madrid and Villarreal secured wins in their respective first legs of the Champions League quarterfinals as they defeated Chelsea and Bayern Munich respectively on Wednesday night. Madrid secured a 3-1 win over the defending champions after striker Karim Benzema scored a hat-trick. Arnaut Danjuma scored the only goal in Villarreal's victory over Munich.

257.title: Some people like fighting: Supreme Court on 60 cases between husband and wife in 41 years
257.article_body: Reacting to filing of 60 cases against each other by a husband and wife in 41 years, including 11 years of separation, the Supreme Court said, "Some people like fighting." It added, "They want to always be in court. If they don't see court...they don't get sleep." The court referred the parties for mediation, adding that it's a "time-bound process".

258.title: Need to prepare youth to become job creators, not job seekers: Pradhan
258.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Wednesday said there is a need to prepare the youth of the country to become job creators rather than job seekers. "If students only want to become employees, nothing will happen. This country will become a consuming economy. There is a need to make it an employer economy," Pradhan added.

259.title: Wild elephant attacks bus, breaks its windshield in Kerala; video surfaces
259.article_body: A wild elephant who is reportedly known as 'Padayappa' in Kerala's Munnar attacked a KSRTC bus and broke its windshield glass on Wednesday evening. A video of the incident was shared on Twitter by IAS officer Supriya Sahu. Reports said the bus had 50 passengers onboard and was on its way from Munnar to Udumalpet when incident took place.

260.title: Madras HC upholds TN govt's 7.5% quota to govt school students in medical courses
260.article_body: Madras HC upheld the Tamil Nadu government's decision to give 7.5% reservation to government school students in admission to undergraduate medical courses. "We direct the state to review the quota in five years...steps may be taken to improve the standard of education in government schools so that the reservation may not be further extended beyond five years," the HC said.

261.title: India's first underwater metro tunnel in Kolkata to be ready in 2023
261.article_body: The construction of India's first underwater tunnel in Kolkata under the Hooghly river that will connect Howrah and Kolkata through metro will be made fully functional by 2023. The tunnel corridor is built 33 metres below the riverbed. "Important passage work has...been done...if a technical problem arises...passengers can be taken out through the special passage," the site supervisor said.

262.title: Musk will push Twitter execs to pick up pace: Ex-Tesla board member
262.article_body: Former Tesla board member Steve Westly has advised Twitter executives to put on their track shoes because Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "going to push you to pick up the pace". "Here we are day one...and he's already saying 'Hey, maybe it's time to get that edit function in there.' I think he's going to shake things up," Westly added.

263.title: Reconsider travel to Sri Lanka: US to its citizens amid crisis
263.article_body: Amid the ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka, the US has advised its citizens against travelling to the island nation, citing fuel and medicine shortages and COVID-19. The US State Department also warned citizens to "exercise increased caution in Sri Lanka due to terrorism". "Terrorists may attack with little or no warning, targeting tourist places...hotels...and other public areas," it added.

264.title: Pay heed to accused's mental condition: Akhilesh on Gorakhnath temple attack
264.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav accused BJP of exaggerating the Gorakhnath Temple attack case and asked the authorities to pay heed to accused's mental condition while probing the matter. "His (accused) father said he has a psychiatric problem, dealing with bipolar issue, I feel we need to pay heed to that as well...BJP is a party that exaggerates," Yadav said.

265.title: Govt is working tirelessly to augment India’s health infrastructure: PM Modi
265.article_body: On the occasion of World Health Day on Thursday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter and said the government is working tirelessly to augment India's health infrastructure. "The focus is on ensuring good quality and affordable healthcare to our citizens," he added. "Our focus on affordable healthcare has ensured significant savings for the poor and middle class," he said.

266.title: Man from Liberia held at Delhi airport with cocaine worth ₹89.74 crore
266.article_body: A man from Liberia, carrying 5.9 kilograms of cocaine worth ₹89.74 crore, was arrested by customs officials at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport, as per an official statement. As many as eight packets of off-white and white coloured substances, suspected to be narcotics, in his trolley bag were recovered. The accused was travelling to Delhi from Lagos via Doha.

267.title: No one treated me differently: 'Jalsa' actor on shooting with cerebral palsy
267.article_body: Jalsa actor Surya Kasibhatla, who suffers from cerebral palsy said that no one from the team treated him differently. "I was one among them...I was absolutely comfortable while shooting for 'Jalsa'. Right from my travel logistics to accommodation, food, local travel, everything was seamless experience...The entire cast and crew made sure I am always comfortable and at ease," he added.

268.title: Who are Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters facing US sanctions?
268.article_body: The US, which imposed sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters, identified them as Katerina Tikhonova and Maria Vorontsova. Vorontsova, Putin and his then-wife Lyudmila Shkrebneva's elder daughter, is a paediatric endocrinologist, specialising in genetics and dwarfism, The Independent reported. Katerina, their second-born, is an academic and an ex-acrobatic rock 'n' roll dancer.

269.title: Sania Mirza said my son should become a cricketer, but I don't want him to: Sarfaraz
269.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said several people, including Sania Mirza, suggested that his son Abdullah should become a cricketer, but he doesn't want him to pursue it. He added, "Being a cricketer...I suffered many things that I don't want Abdullah to face. It's human nature. Being a cricketer, I want my brother or son to be selected immediately. Otherwise...it hurts."

270.title: I was going through something in my personal life, was depressed: Uthappa on RCB days
270.article_body: CSK batter Robin Uthappa has revealed that he was completely into depression during his first season with RCB in 2009 as he was going through something in his personal life. He added, "I didn't play well even for one game that season." Uthappa was transferred from MI to RCB after the inaugural season of IPL in 2008.

271.title: Today, it is very hard for me to call him Mahi bhai: Robin Uthappa on MS Dhoni
271.article_body: Talking about his friendship with MS Dhoni, CSK batter Robin Uthappa said, "Today...it's very hard for me to call him Mahi bhai because when I got to know him he was Mahi, MS." Uthappa added, "I played with him after 10+ years. I asked him, 'What should I call you?' He [said], 'Call me...MS or Mahi or however you want'."

272.title: All secular forces need to come together to defeat BJP: Yechury
272.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Wednesday urged all the secular and democratic forces to come together to defeat BJP. "All secular forces should come together to dump the party driven by the Hindutva ideology," Yechury added. "It (BJP) has to be isolated and defeated. It is undermining all the constitutional bodies and selling off PSUs one by one," Yechury stated.

273.title: One person arrested for duping over 250 job aspirants in Lucknow
273.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Special Task Force (STF) on Wednesday arrested one person for allegedly duping over 250 job aspirants in Lucknow. The accused, identified as Prateek Mishra, posed as an IAS/IPS officer and duped job seekers on pretext of providing them jobs in the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS). The STF recovered fake IPS ID card and appointment letters from the accused.

274.title: Vigilance bureau books 2 Punjab Police officials for taking bribe of over ₹1.5 lakh
274.article_body: Two Punjab Police officials were booked in Ferozepur for allegedly taking over ₹1.5 lakh as a bribe from a man after the audio recording of the incident was submitted to the vigilance bureau. The duo had seized 4 kg of poppy husk from the complainant’s father last year. Later, they threatened the complainant.

275.title: Political messages on answer papers will invite penal action: WB education council
275.article_body: Students who write political messages or drawings on their Class 12 exams answer papers will invite penal action, West Bengal Council of Higher Secondary Education (WBCHSE) said. "Examiners...instructed not to evaluate such answer papers," WBCHSE added. This comes after examiners found that a number of students, appearing for Class 10 exams conducted earlier, wrote 'Khela Hobe' on answer papers.

276.title: India's power grid targeted by suspected Chinese hackers near Ladakh: Report
276.article_body: Suspected China-backed hackers targeted India's power sector in recent months under an apparent cyber-espionage campaign, as per US-based threat intelligence firm Recorded Future. The hackers focused on around seven "load dispatch" centres that disperse electricity in areas near the India-China border in Ladakh, it said. They reportedly compromised an Indian national emergency response system.

277.title: If Venkatesh didn't have Cummins at the other end, KKR would've lost: Jaffer
277.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has said KKR would've lost to MI had Pat Cummins not smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history. "Venkatesh Iyer was finding it hard to time the ball even though he got fifty. If Iyer didn't have Cummins at the other end, KKR might not have won," he stated. Cummins scored 56* off 15 against MI.

278.title: E-commerce firm JD.com's founder steps down as CEO after 19 yrs
278.article_body: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com's Founder Richard Liu has stepped down as the CEO of the firm after 19 years. Company president Lei Xu has been appointed as the new CEO. Liu will stay on as chairman of the Beijing-headquartered firm. Xu, who has been at the firm for over 10 years, will also join the board as an executive director.

279.title: Mumbai woman trying to file complaint against auto driver loses ₹1 lakh
279.article_body: A 51-year-old Mumbai woman lost nearly ₹1 lakh while trying to register complaint against an auto driver. The woman was left midway by the auto driver, following which she began looking for the cab aggregator's customer care number and contacted a fraudulent number, police said. However, on pretext of providing a refund, the executive siphoned off money from her account.

280.title: 60% of Delhi traffic police personnel suffer from hypertension: Report
280.article_body: Nearly 60% of the 5,500 traffic police personnel in Delhi suffer from hypertension, according to reports of their medical check-ups conducted in February this year. Further, 20% of them have diabetes while 10% have hearing problems, the reports added. Direct exposure to air and noise pollution, job stress and irregular sleep were cited as reasons for these medical conditions.

281.title: Ex-police officer alleges attack by car recovery agents in Ahmedabad
281.article_body: Retired SP, Narendra K Amin, filed a police complaint in Ahmedabad claiming that he was allegedly attacked by four recovery agents who claimed to be from the crime branch and tried to seize his car. Amin also accused his two former business associates of fraud. He claimed that the car was under Preeti Dalal's name, his former business associate.

282.title: Haryana Education Minister should be sacked: Surjewala on paper leak
282.article_body: After reports that five question papers of the Haryana Board's Class 10 and 12 were leaked, Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala demanded the removal of Haryana Education Minister Kanwar Pal. Surjewala criticised the Haryana government, saying that Khattar-Chautala government is responsible for "ruining" the education system in the state and making students dependent on the "copying mafia".

283.title: Married 3 months ago, Guj man killed for objecting to comments on wife
283.article_body: Shabbir Lalpariya from Gujarat, who got married three months ago, was stabbed to death after he got into fight as four men teased his wife. Prime accused Zuber's cousin brother Mohsin passed objectionable comments at Shabbir's wife, after which Shabbir and Mohsin got into argument. Later, Zuber slapped Shabbir in Chandni Bazaar, where Shabbir was also stabbed multiple times.

284.title: Russia must not win the war against Ukraine: German Chancellor
284.article_body: Addressing the lawmakers in the federal Parliament, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Wednesday said, "It has to remain our goal that Russia does not win this war [against Ukraine]." Speaking of the reported war crimes by Russian forces, Scholz said, "The perpetrators and those who commissioned them have to be held accountable."

285.title: We got behind in first 10 overs while batting: MI coach Jayawardena
285.article_body: Talking about their defeat against KKR, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said they knew it'll be "hard to work through" the initial overs but they took a little more time to establish themselves as they kept losing wickets. "I thought we built it up nicely...[but then] got behind in first 10 overs," he added. MI were 54/2 after 10 overs.

286.title: Pune witnesses hottest day of year at 40.1°C
286.article_body: Pune on Wednesday witnessed its hottest day of the year at 40.1 degrees Celsius. As per the forecast of the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the city will experience similar hot days ahead this week. Reportedly, the minimum temperatures in Pune have remained between 18 and 26 degrees Celsius, which were significantly above normal for April.

287.title: US man who lived in daughter's dorm convicted of abusing her friends
287.article_body: A 62-year-old US man, Lawrence Ray, was convicted of exploiting his daughter's college friends for years by using threats and violence to make himself rich. Ray met the students when he moved into his daughter's dorm in a New York college after completing a prison stint. Found guilty on 15 counts, the convict faces life in prison.

288.title: Boy kills father over fear of being 'thrown out' if he fails in exams in MP
288.article_body: A 15-year-old boy killed his 46-year-old father with an axe over the fear of being "thrown out" if he fails in Class 10 exams in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, police said. He burnt his fingers so that his fingerprints on the axe don't match, police added. The boy had not prepared for the exams and feared failing, police further said.

289.title: Asked to stop spitting, man assaults 18-yr-old on Thane local
289.article_body: A 33-year-old man allegedly beat up an 18-year-old boy after the teenager asked him to stop spitting from the footboard of Titwala-bound local train in Thane on Tuesday. The man started assaulting the teenager on the moving train for teaching him cleanliness. Later, he got down at next station and beat up the boy again with a stone, police said.

290.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire reveals 11.4% stake in HP worth $4.2 bn
290.article_body: Billionaire Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway has disclosed its purchase of nearly 121 million shares of HP, giving it a roughly 11.4% stake worth about $4.2 billion. HP shares jumped nearly 10% to $38.38 in after-hours trading after Berkshire disclosed the stake in SEC filings. In March, Berkshire agreed to buy insurance company Alleghany for $11.6 billion in cash.

291.title: After Delhi, Punjab, it’s Himachal’s turn to see a revolution: Kejriwal
291.article_body: After Delhi and Punjab, it’s Himachal Pradesh’s turn to bring in a revolution, AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said on Wednesday. Kejriwal and Punjab CM  Bhagwant Mann led a roadshow in Himachal’s Mandi ahead of state Assembly polls. "We don't know how to do politics but we certainly know how to build schools and hospitals and eradicate corruption," Kejriwal added.

292.title: Simon Doull clarifies his 'social media star' statement on RR's Riyan Parag
292.article_body: Commentator Simon Doull clarified after a Twitter user criticised him for saying, "I know [RR all-rounder] Riyan Parag is a social media star...but that doesn't count in a match." "Social media says...he's popular...but that doesn't count when he's in...middle...Runs and strike rate is his currency and IMO it's not good enough. Maybe it's lost in translation a little...sorry," Doull wrote.

293.title: Won't fill petrol for less than ₹50: Maharashtra petrol pump's notice amid rising prices
293.article_body: A petrol pump in Maharashtra's Nagpur has refused to sell petrol for less than ₹50 amid rising prices. "It's not viable to operate machines for giving such...small quantity of petrol as they consume high electricity. We took this decision to avoid...scuffle," the petrol pump owner said. "When drivers ask for petrol worth ₹20-₹30...machine hits the amount within seconds," he added.

294.title: Ensured to not go overboard, Madhuri can't look vulgar: Indra on 'Dhak Dhak..'
294.article_body: 'Beta' director Indra Kumar said that the team ensured that they do not go overboard with the song 'Dhak Dhak Karne Laga'. "The idea [was] it should not be vulgar...And we succeeded. Families  watched it together....We ensured that we should not go overboard. Madhuri [Dixit] anyway is so graceful. She can't ever look vulgar, " Indra added.

295.title: 33-year-old man held with mephedrone worth ₹27.2 lakh in Pune
295.article_body:
Police have arrested a 33-year-old man with at least 272 grams of mephedrone worth ₹27.2 lakh in Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad. The accused, Nadim Inayat Patel, was reportedly intercepted by police at Sudhavadi in Maval on Tuesday at 11:15 pm, following a tip-off. Along with the contraband, police 
also seized a four-wheeler vehicle and two cell phones from the accused.

296.title: India sends 270,000 MT of petrol, diesel to Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis
296.article_body: India has supplied more than 270,000 MT of petrol and diesel to Sri Lanka so far under a credit line to help ease the power crisis amid the country's worst economic crisis in decades. "One consignment each of 36,000 MT petrol and 40,000 MT diesel was delivered to SriLanka in the last 24 hours," India High Commission in Colombo tweeted.

297.title: Man who bought NFT of world's first-ever tweet for $2.9 mn is reselling it for $48 mn
297.article_body: A non-fungible token (NFT) of the world's first-ever tweet is being resold for $48 million. The tweet, which read "just setting up my twttr", was sent by Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey in 2006. Malaysia-based Sina Estavi, CEO of blockchain service Bridge Oracle purchased the NFT for $2.9 million in March 2021. Estavi said he'd donate 50% of proceeds to charity.

298.title: AAP Youth Wing leader arrested for assaulting policemen in Gujarat
298.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Youth Wing leader Yuvrajsinh Jadeja was arrested for allegedly assaulting policemen and dragging a constable on his car's bonnet in Gujarat's Gandhinagar, police said. "We had detained 55 Vidyasahayak recruitment protesters ...Jadeja had followed them...assaulted policemen present over there," police added. "BJP government framed him in a fake case," Gujarat AAP chief said.

299.title: Extraordinary! I couldn't believe the way Cummins was hitting: Shreyas
299.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said he couldn't believe the way pacer Pat Cummins was hitting the ball during their match against MI, which they won by five wickets. "Extraordinary!...because in the nets, he was getting bowled now and then," added Shreyas. "The plan was for Venkatesh to drop anchor and tell Pat to just swing at everything," he further said.

300.title: Haryana man kills 13-yr-old daughter over suspicion of love affair
300.article_body: A man allegedly strangulated his 13-year-old daughter in Haryana's Sonepat over suspicion of her affair with a man from the same village. "The girl's father claimed...she died after falling from stairs," said Sonepat Sadar SHO Deepti Garg. "The autopsy revealed...there were injury marks on the girl's body and she died due to strangulation. We have arrested the father," she added.

301.title: BEST starts AC bus services between T1, T2 of Mumbai airport
301.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electricity Supply and Transport (BEST) will be running AC bus services between Terminal 1 and Terminal 2 of Mumbai Airport from today. The bus service will be available 24 hours, at a frequency of 20- 30 minutes depending on the air traffic, officials said. The bus charges will be fixed at ₹50 for each trip, inclusive of luggage.

302.title: MNS leaders give 4-day ultimatum to remove loudspeakers from Pune mosques
302.article_body: Days after MNS chief Raj Thackeray demanded removal of loudspeakers from mosques, party leaders have given Pune Police a 4-day ultimatum to remove loudspeakers from city mosques. "We had given an ultimatum to Pune police to remove loudspeakers from mosques...If the police fail to do so, we will play Hanuman Chalisa in front of mosques," MNS leader Hemant Sambhus said.

303.title: Trains running slower than expected, punctuality declined: CAG
303.article_body: The travel time of trains has increased and punctuality declined, said a Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report tabled in Parliament. "The punctuality of mail/express trains over IR declined from 79% (2012-13) to 69% (2018-19)," said the report. It added that 123 out of 478 superfast trains ran at slower speeds than the specified 55 kmph.

304.title: Suspected Chinese hackers targeted India's power grid to collect data: Report
304.article_body: Suspected China-backed hackers have targeted India's power grids in the recent months under an apparent cyber-espionage campaign, Recorded Future reported. The hackers targeted at least seven "load dispatch" centres responsible for operations for grid control and electricity dispersal. The hacking group, TAG-38, used a malicious software which has previously been associated with China's PLA.

305.title: Pune woman's stalker attacks her neighbour after being rejected, held
305.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery boy in Pune who was stalking a 19-year-old woman attacked her 39-year-old neighbour with a sharp weapon after the woman asked him to leave her alone several times. Police said that the accused and the woman knew each other. The woman's grandmother had called the neighbours for help after accused threatened to harm the woman.

306.title: I thought we had the game till the 15th over: Rohit on defeat vs KKR
306.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said he thought they had the game till the 15th over of KKR's innings during their match on Wednesday night. "Never expected Cummins to come and play like that...It'll be hard to digest," he added. KKR were 127/5 after 15 overs when Cummins scored 35 runs in the 16th over to chase down MI's 162-run target.

307.title: Ludhiana man suspected to be kidnapper helps 4-yr-old reunite with family
307.article_body: A man, suspected to be the kidnapper of a four-year-old based on CCTV footage, turned out to be a Good Samaritan and helped her reunite with her parents in Ludhiana. The girl went missing after losing her way while playing outside her mother's workplace. The man found her, posted her picture on Facebook and urged netizens to find her parents.

308.title: Citizens group wants Bengaluru’s Cubbon Park declared 'no-honking zone'
308.article_body: A citizen group called Citizens for Citizens (C4C), in collaboration with Mount Carmel College students, launched an awareness campaign at Cubbon Park on Tuesday, urging people to avoid mindless honking. The volunteers requested police to notify the Cubbon Park area as a honking-free/silence zone. The request in this regard has been submitted to Rajender Kataria, Principal Secretary (Transport).

309.title: Mumbai man loses ₹1.86 lakh in sextortion, male escort fraud case
309.article_body: A 30-year-old Mumbai-based man lost ₹1.86 lakh in two cheating cases. He lost ₹60,000 in a sextortion racket in which two females, after befriending him on Facebook, got involved in obscene acts over video calls and later, threatened him of posting the videos online. The victim also lost ₹1.26 lakh in a fake advertisement online which provided male escort jobs.

310.title: KTR inaugurates Wipro manufacturing facility in Hyd's Maheshwaram
310.article_body: Telangana Minister for Municipal Administration and Urban Development KT Rama Rao, along with Minister for Education Sabitha Reddy and Wipro group founder Azim Premji, inaugurated a Wipro manufacturing facility in Hyderabad's Maheshwaram on Tuesday. "Wipro has invested ₹300 crore to set up their facility and is creating direct and indirect employment for about 900 people," KTR tweeted.

311.title: 17-yr-old girl falls off cliff while trying to take selfie in Thane
311.article_body: Police have launched a search for a 17-year-old girl who fell from a cliff in Thane on Wednesday afternoon. The girl, identified as Damini Dinkarrao, had gone to Gorakhgad with her friends on a trek. "While they were coming down...she was clicking selfies from the edge of the mountain and accidentally fell from around 60 feet height," an officer said.

312.title: MakeMyTrip launches Great Summer Travel Sale from 7th-12th April
312.article_body: Aiming to help travellers make the most of the upcoming travel season, MakeMyTrip has launched the Great Summer Travel Sale from 7-12 April with offers like up to 20% off on domestic flights, up to ₹15,000 off on international flights and up to 30% off on domestic and international hotels & homestays. Offers on other travel options are also available.

313.title: Not nominated for award probably because I'm boring; don't drink, smoke: Tijori
313.article_body: Filmmaker Deepak Tijori said it doesn't "hurt him" to not have won an award. "I have not even...been nominated till date...I guess probably because I've not been social animal. I don't drink, I don't smoke. I am boring, vegetarian man!" he added. He further said he played a role in 'Baadshah' as he had a good equation with the director.

314.title: Pat diye chakke: Shah Rukh Khan as Cummins slams joint-fastest IPL fifty to help KKR win
314.article_body: KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan took to Instagram to praise his team following their win against MI. "Wow again...@patcummins30 I want to dance like @ar12russell and hug you like the whole team did," he wrote. "Wow...well done KKR and what else is there to say! 'Pat' diye chakke!" he added. Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest IPL fifty off 14 deliveries.

315.title: Rohit says 'Awaaz badhao yaar' in frustration during post-match interview, video viral
315.article_body: A video of MI captain Rohit Sharma saying 'Awaaz badhao yaar uska thoda (Increase his volume)' during post-match interview following their defeat against KKR has gone viral. "This pretty much explains the result," a fan tweeted. "This will be hard to digest how it turned out to be in the last couple of overs," Rohit later said in the interview.

316.title: Amnesty Int’l asks India to revoke travel ban on Aakar Patel
316.article_body: Amnesty International has asked the Indian government to revoke what it called an "arbitrary travel ban" imposed on author Aakar Patel. This comes after Patel, former chief of Amnesty India, was stopped from flying to US at Bengaluru airport. The global human rights body said the action against Patel shows India's "mounting crackdown on human rights defenders and activists".

317.title: MI's Daniel Sams bowls most expensive over of IPL 2022
317.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) fast bowler Daniel Sams bowled the most expensive over of IPL 2022 so far against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) after conceding 35 runs in his third over of the match on Wednesday. Sams was hit for four sixes and two fours by Pat Cummins. He also bowled a no-ball, on which Cummins scored two runs.

318.title: Performed 'Khuda..' climax in boarding school, said 'Dad has done it': Abhishek
318.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said that he used to perform the climax of 'Khuda Gawah' in boarding school. "My friends, who were all foreigners...used to think I am a freak because I used to put on that climax, and perform it...I told them my dad has done it...they were very encouraging but...must have thought 'what is he doing?'," Abhishek added.

319.title: DTC bus catches fire in Delhi's Mahipalpur, shops gutted
319.article_body: A Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus caught fire in the Mahipalpur area on Wednesday and a few shops near it were also gutted, officials said. No casualty was reported, officials added. The bus was running past its annual maintenance contract, officials further said. "The bus...plying on Route No. 534/39 was burnt due to smoke from its engine," DTC said.

320.title: Father sells newborn baby for ₹1 lakh in Delhi; held along with 5 others
320.article_body: Delhi Police have recovered a newborn baby after he was kidnapped and arrested six persons, including his father, in connection with the case. Police said, "The [baby's father]...was facing losses in...business and wanted to sell his child to earn money...He was paid around ₹1 lakh." Police said the accused allegedly kidnapped the infant after spiking his mother's food with sedatives.

321.title: BMTC launches digital passes for passengers to travel in B'luru buses
321.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation has launched mobile-based digital passes for bus passengers. People have to buy the BMTC's daily, weekly and monthly passes through the mobile application Tummoc and they've to show it on their mobile phone to the conductor. The digital pass will be generated along with a unique ID, validity and dynamic QR code, an official said.

322.title: First-ever ODI hundred was scored in the second ODI
322.article_body: ODI cricket's first-ever hundred was scored by England's Dennis Amiss in the second ODI against Australia in August 1972, a year after the first-ever ODI. Amiss, born on April 7, 1943, scored the hundred off 130 balls in what was his debut match. He also shared the first-ever ODI hundred partnership, adding 125 runs with Keith Fletcher in the match.

323.title: Present evidence doesn't suggest presence of 'XE' variant: Govt on reports of 1st case
323.article_body: After reports confirmed India's first case of 'XE' variant in Mumbai, government said present evidence doesn't suggest the presence of the new variant. "FastQ files in respect of the sample were analysed in detail by genomic experts of INSACOG who have inferred that the genomic constitution of this variant doesn't correlate with...genomic picture of 'XE' variant," government added.

324.title: Cummins smashes joint-fastest fifty in IPL as KKR hand MI their 3rd straight defeat
324.article_body: KKR's Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history as KKR handed MI their third straight defeat in IPL 2022. Cummins reached the 50-run mark off 14 deliveries, equalling the record of KL Rahul, who had scored a 14-ball fifty against Delhi Capitals in IPL 2018. KKR chased down the 162-run target in 16 overs.

325.title: Cummins smashes joint-fastest fifty in IPL as KKR hand MI their 3rd straight defeat
325.article_body: KKR's Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history as KKR handed MI their third straight defeat in IPL 2022. Cummins reached the 50-run mark off 14 deliveries, equalling the record of PBKS captain KL Rahul, who had scored a 14-ball fifty against Delhi Capitals in IPL 2018. KKR chased down the 162-run target in 16 overs.

326.title: NEET exam to be held on July 17, JEE (Main) postponed to June & July
326.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) said on Wednesday that the NEET examination will be held on July 17 while JEE (Main) 2022 examinations have been rescheduled to give students across the nation more time to prepare. The JEE Session 1 examination will be held from June 20-29 while Session 2 examination will be held from July 21-30, the notification read.

327.title: Kourtney Kardashian shares pics from her Las Vegas wedding with Travis Barker
327.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian, taking to Instagram, shared pictures from her wedding with Travis Barker in Las Vegas. "After an epic night and a little tequila, a queen and her handsome king ventured out to the only open chapel with an Elvis and got married (with no license)," Kourtney captioned the post. The duo got married hours after the Grammys 2022 ceremony.

328.title: Le Tissier leaves ambassador role at Southampton after Ukraine tweet
328.article_body: Matt Le Tissier on Wednesday announced he is resigning from his role as ambassador for Southampton after receiving backlash over sharing a conspiracy theory regarding the killings of civilians in Bucha by Russian troops. Le Tissier suggested the media had "lied" about the killings, before deleting the post. Le Tissier had served as an official ambassador for Southampton since 2019.

329.title: We will not be going near there: Liverpool's Klopp on Haaland transfer
329.article_body: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp on Wednesday said he will not try to sign Borussia Dortmund striker Erling Haaland during the summer transfer window. "The figures being mentioned out there are crazy. We have nothing to do with them. No chance," the former Dortmund manager said. The cost to buy the 21-year-old in a multi-year deal could reportedly exceed €300 million.

330.title: India sent over 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka in last 24 hours
330.article_body: In the last 24 hours, India has sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka, which is seeing a power crisis. "One consignment each of 36,000 MT petrol and 40,000 MT diesel was delivered...in the last 24 hours. Total supply of various types of fuel under Indian assistance...stands at more than 270,000 MT," Indian Embassy in Sri Lanka revealed.

331.title: George Russell optimistic Mercedes can 'overtake' Ferrari, Red Bull
331.article_body: George Russell is optimistic that Mercedes can "overtake" Ferrari and Red Bull to fight for the Formula One world championship this season. "It's a very long season, I think we've all got confidence that if we do things right, there's no reason why we can't close the gap and potentially overtake [Ferrari and Red Bull]," Russell said.

332.title: BJP world's largest party, earned faith of crores of people: BJP leader
332.article_body: Senior BJP leader Murli Manohar Joshi on Wednesday said, "BJP is not just country's but world's largest party. It has earned the faith of crores of people, presented them with a different ideology." He further added, "It should now focus on bringing solutions to problems arising out of present-day needs." BJP celebrated its 42nd Foundation Day on April 6.

333.title: Ancelotti tests negative for COVID-19, will travel for Chelsea match
333.article_body: Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti on Wednesday tested negative for COVID-19, meaning he will travel to London ahead of Real Madrid's UEFA Champions League quarter-final first-leg match against Chelsea on Wednesday. Ancelotti tested positive for COVID-19 last week. "He will travel to London this morning to join the first-team camp," Real Madrid said in a statement.

334.title: Wish Travis, Kourtney the best that life has to offer: Ex-wife Shanna
334.article_body: Reacting to the reports of Travis Barker and Kourtney Kardashian's Las Vegas wedding, Travis' ex-wife Shanna Moakler congratulated the couple. "I wish them the best that life has to offer on their journey together," Shanna told People magazine. According to a report by TMZ, Kourtney and Travis' marriage isn't legal as they didn't get a licence for the same.

335.title: Ronald Koeman to replace Louis van Gaal as Dutch boss after World Cup
335.article_body: The Royal Dutch Football Association (KNVB) on Wednesday announced that former Barcelona manager Ronald Koeman will replace Louis van Gaal as manager after the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. Van Gaal said last week he is receiving treatment for prostate cancer. Koeman's first stint as manager of the national team ended in August 2020 so he could join Barcelona.

336.title: Have urged Putin to declare ceasefire in Ukraine: Hungarian PM Orban
336.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said on Wednesday that he had urged Russian President Vladimir Putin to declare immediate ceasefire in Ukraine. Orban added that he offered to host talks between Russia and Ukraine, to which Putin's response was "positive" but came with conditions. Notably, Hungary has refused to supply any ammunition to Ukraine or allow its transit through its territory.

337.title: Moon Knight's character struggles with mental health issues: Curtis
337.article_body: 'Moon Knight' executive producer Grant Curtis said Moon Knight is a "very complex" character and is struggling with mental health issues. "He has...very complex life that he's trying to juggle, but in [many] ways, he's...similar to...Marvel offerings in the past," Curtis stated. "One thing...people don't...grasp is that at the heart of all Marvel movies, there's a character study," he added.

338.title: Identify all illegal immigrants from Myanmar, B'desh: J&K HC to govt
338.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir High Court has directed the Home Secretary of the Union Territory, RK Goyal, to evolve a mechanism for the identification of illegal immigrants from Myanmar and Bangladesh. The Court's order came following a PIL, which gave directions to shift illegal immigrants from J&K, as no refugee camp has been declared in the Union Territory.

339.title: Fire breaks out at Congress' headquarters in New Delhi
339.article_body: A fire broke out at Congress party headquarters in New Delhi's Akbar Road on Wednesday around 7 pm. "There was an electric fault in ACs due to which the fire occurred. It has been doused completely," an official from the Connaught Place Fire Station said. The caretaker and guards had alerted the fire department and police about the incident.

340.title: Was shocked when R Balki approached me for 'Chup...': Dulquer Salmaan
340.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said that he was "shocked" when filmmaker R Balki approached him for his upcoming film 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist'. "I was shocked and said, 'Are you really thinking about me for this role?' Because it's something I haven't done before," Dulquer said. The actor further said that the psychological thriller is "an experimental film".

341.title: SRK to begin shooting for Hirani's film around April 15: Report
341.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly begin shooting for his upcoming film with director Rajkumar Hirani around April 15. "Hirani has the habit of keeping a gap between two schedules...While Hirani will work on his edit of 40-day work, Shah Rukh, in the meantime, will shoot for Atlee's next," a source stated. The shooting will take place in Mumbai.

342.title: Parliament passes Bill that seeks to collect biometrics of convicts
342.article_body: Parliament passed Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill that seeks to allow investigating agencies to collect physical and biological samples of convicts and persons accused of crimes. Union Minister Amit Shah said, "I want to assure this isn't going to violate anyone's privacy." Political detainees' biometrics won't be collected if they are detained during participation in protest, he added.

343.title: Why is he speaking on our issue?: Muskan's father on Zawahiri's video
343.article_body: After his daughter Muskan was praised by Al-Qaeda chief Ayman Al Zawahiri amid the hijab controversy, Mohammed Hussain said, "I don't even know who he is...We don't need Al-Qaeda to speak about our country's issues." In February, Muskan had defended wearing hijab and chanted 'Allah-hu-Akbar'. Her father said the video disturbed Muskan and she is worried about her education.

344.title: Haryana govt reciting tables of 35 & 80 while hiking fuel rates: Hooda
344.article_body: Former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Wednesday said, "It seems as if the government is reading the table of 35 and 80 with petroleum products". He added, "Petrol and diesel in Haryana were cheaper than the neighbouring states under the erstwhile Congress government." Fuel in Haryana is now more expensive than its neighbours after multiple hikes, Hooda added.

345.title: Parliament saw healthy discussion on Ukraine, grateful to MPs: PM
345.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said the Parliament witnessed a healthy discussion on the Ukraine situation and India's repatriation initiative 'Operation Ganga' in the last few days. He thanked MPs for enriching the discussion with their views. "The rich level of debate and constructive points illustrate how there is bipartisanship when it comes to matters of foreign policy," he tweeted.

346.title: What is the 'no-fault divorce' law that has come into force in England?
346.article_body: The 'no-fault divorce' law, which came into force on Wednesday in England, allows unhappy spouses to end their marriages without blaming each other. The onset of no-fault divorces means spouses no longer need to prove each other guilty of adultery, unreasonable behaviour or desertion. While experts expect a rush of divorces, they predict it could also increase rates of marriage.

347.title: China calls for probe into "disturbing" killings in Ukraine's Bucha
347.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Zhao Lijian on Wednesday said that reports and images about the deaths of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha are "deeply disturbing". Lijian said the truth and specific causes of the incident should be verified, adding that blame shouldn't be apportioned before the "truth" is verified.
