Reportedly, China has refused to criticise Russia for its actions in Ukraine.

348.title: Maruti Suzuki to recall 19,731 EECO cars to rectify wheel size marking
348.article_body: India's largest car manufacturer Maruti Suzuki on Wednesday said it'll voluntarily recall 19,731 units of its EECO model to inspect and rectify incorrect marking of wheel size. The incorrect marking has been found in units manufactured between July 19, 2021 and October 5, 2021. "The issue has no implication on performance, safety or environment," the carmaker said in a statement.

349.title: Only use CUET for UG admissions: UGC directs Central Universities
349.article_body: The University Grants Commission on Wednesday directed the Central Universities to only use Common University Entrance Test (CUET) scores to admit students in undergraduate programmes, except for activity-oriented courses, such as performing arts. Meanwhile, the application process for the CUET 2022 for admission to undergraduate programmes began on Wednesday.

350.title: Being denied basic human needs, aim is to humiliate me: Majithia
350.article_body: SAD leader Bikram Singh Majithia has filed a plea alleging denial of "basic human needs" with the "sole view of humiliating him". He further said he was being subjected to an "insecure atmosphere" and "poor living conditions" at the Patiala Central Jail. Majithia added that he has been moved to a dilapidated cell which is used to punish inmates.

351.title: She's very straight up: Shahid on Mira being critical of his films
351.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has said that his wife Mira Rajput is "very straight up" while being critical of all his films. However, he added that she doesn't "waste her time" commenting on his bad films. "She's like, 'it's so bad I don't want to comment on it. Let's talk about the ones that are decent'," Shahid further stated.

352.title: It's becoming difficult for Putin to fund Ukrainian war: White House
352.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Tuesday said that it's becoming difficult for Russian President Vladimir Putin to fund the war in Ukraine. Psaki said, "What we're doing and we're already seeing effectively happen is...financial system in Russia is near the brink of collapse." Terming Putin a "war criminal", Psaki added the US is working to hold Russia accountable.

353.title: Greece, Cyprus & Israel to expand their energy cooperation
353.article_body: Greece, Cyprus and Israel will continue to expand their energy cooperation through natural gas pipelines with added focus on reducing Europe's dependency on Russian energy imports, the countries' foreign ministers said on Tuesday. The countries will build an underwater power cable that will link their electricity grids. Another project aimed to supply Europe with natural gas was also approved.

354.title: Govt to celebrate 'Yoga Mahotsav' at Red Fort in Delhi tomorrow
354.article_body: The Ministry of AYUSH will hold a 'Yoga Mahotsav' at the Red Fort in Delhi on World Health Day on April 7 (Thursday). Tomorrow is also the 75th day of the countdown to International Day of Yoga, which is observed on June 21. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla is likely to be the chief guest at the event.

355.title: Ties with Pakistan are unbreakable: China amid Pak political crisis
355.article_body: Amid Pakistan political crisis, Chinese Foreign Ministry said that its ties with Pakistan are "unbreakable and rock solid". The ministry added Pakistan's internal turmoil won't affect the overall cooperation between the "all-weather allies". Notably, Imran Khan has been de-notified as PM of Pakistan as the President dissolved the National Assembly after it rejected a no-trust move against Khan.

356.title: US imposes sanctions on Russian President Putin's daughters
356.article_body: The US has announced new sanctions on Russian financial institutions and individuals, including Russian President Vladimir Putin's two daughters. The US also announced sanctions on the wife and daughter of Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov. The sanctions aim to increase economic pressure on Russia and Putin himself amid the massacre in Ukraine's Bucha.

357.title: Al-Qaeda will never understand but Indian Muslims will: Assam CM
357.article_body: Responding to Al-Qaeda chief Ayman Mohammed Rabie al-Zawahiri's comment on the ongoing hijab row in India, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "Al-Qaeda will never understand, but Indian Muslims will". The Al-Qaeda chief, in a video released on Tuesday, asked the Muslims to fight the assault on Islam "intellectually, using the media and with weapons on the battlefield."

358.title: West derailing our peace talks with Ukraine, fuelling hysteria: Russia
358.article_body: Kremlin said on Wednesday that peace talks between Moscow and Kyiv weren't progressing rapidly. Russia has also accused the West of fuelling "hysteria" over allegations of war crimes by Russian troops in Ukraine's Bucha in a bid to derail peace talks. Ukraine has urged more sanctions against Russia for civilian killings in Bucha, a charge Russia has termed "monstrous forgery".

359.title: India should be less worried about giving 'gyan' to world: Jaishankar
359.article_body: Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar on Wednesday said that India should focus on its national interests and be less "concerned" about giving "gyan" to the world. The House passed the bill, which was introduced in the Lok Sabha on April 5, that seeks to "prohibit" financing of "any activity" in relation to weapons of mass destruction.

360.title: IAS officer's tweets on how to be 'smart aspirant' for interview go viral
360.article_body: IAS officer Jitin Yadav's tweets on preparing for UPSC interviews are going viral. "A smart aspirant not only prepares well for interview but also try to know background of UPSC Chairman and Members who will be heading interview boards," he wrote. He also shared information about UPSC Chairman Dr Manoj Soni and other members including, Sujata Mehta and Smita Nagaraj.

361.title: Delighted that Hrithik, Sussanne have found love again: Pooja Bedi
361.article_body: Pooja Bedi has said she's "delighted" that Hrithik Roshan and Sussanne Khan "have found love again". This comes after pictures of Hrithik and his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad partying with Sussanne and her rumoured boyfriend Arslan Goni were shared by Pooja. Speaking to the Times of India, she said that Sussanne hosted the party to launch a cafe in Goa.

362.title: Cinema is more about stories now, not just box office numbers: Sanjana
362.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi has said that Indian cinema is more about stories now and not just about box office business. "For so long...it had become all about the numbers and the box office business. In that sense, now (when stories are prioritised) is the best time to be a young leading actor in the industry," she stated.

363.title: Sidhant was in trance whole time during 'Operation...' shoot: Bhumika
363.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla has said that working with Sidhant Gupta in 'Operation Romeo' was a "brilliant" experience. "Sidhant was in a trance the whole time," she stated. "There's one type where you go to the disco and listen to trance and the other one is where you absorb the entire character...and live it thoroughly, I observed that," she added.

364.title: Display your names in Marathi 1st, then other languages: BMC to shop owners
364.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation of Mumbai on Wednesday ordered shop owners to display the names of their shops first in Marathi in capital letters followed by other languages. It added that the font size of Marathi letters should be bigger than others. "The names of visionary men, forts shouldn't be written on nameplates of liquor shops," the order added.

365.title: Minority killings in J&K was at peak in 2021,11 people killed: MHA
365.article_body: The killing of people belonging to minority communities in Jammu and Kashmir was at its peak in 2021, with 11 deaths, the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) stated in the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. "The government has taken several measures to ensure the safety of minorities in the valley," said Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai.

366.title: Meta employees 'lovingly' call me 'The Eye of Sauron': Mark Zuckerberg
366.article_body: During an appearance on The Tim Ferriss Show, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "Some of the folks I work with at the company, they say this lovingly, but I think that they sometimes refer to my attention as the Eye of Sauron." Zuckerberg was referring to the Lord of the Rings villain usually depicted as a flaming eye.

367.title: Anil Deshmukh sent to CBI custody till April 11 in extortion case
367.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh was sent to CBI custody till April 11 in connection with an alleged extortion case. The agency took Deshmukh into its custody from Arthur Road jail earlier today and presented him before a court. Seeking his custody for 10 days, CBI claimed he's trying to evade questioning and that's why he's citing health reasons.

368.title: 2,105 migrants returned to Kashmir after repeal of Article 370: Rai
368.article_body: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Wednesday said that about 2,105 migrants have returned to the Kashmir valley after the repeal of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir. He said that they returned to take up jobs provided by the Prime Minister's Development Package, adding that 841 appointments were made in 2020-2021, followed by 1,264 in 2021-2022.

369.title: Great white shark kills 2 swimmers as body washes ashore in Durban
369.article_body: Two swimmers have been killed by a great white shark in a series of fatal attacks in Durban, South Africa. The first victim was discovered after his body was found washed up by a walker. South Africa's emergency medical services Netcare 911 said portions of the man's body were missing while multiple shark bites were clearly visible on the body.

370.title: Mushrooms can talk to each other and recognise up to 50 words: Research
370.article_body: Mushrooms can talk to each other and recognise up to 50 words, according to a research. The study of the electrical activity of four species of fungi found electrical impulses were structurally similar to human speech and resembled vocabulary of dozens of words. The research was conducted by professor Andrew Adamatzky from University of the West of England.

371.title: Pope Francis condemns massacre of Bucha, kisses Ukrainian flag
371.article_body: Pope Francis on Wednesday kissed a Ukrainian flag and condemned the massacre of Bucha where bodies tied and shot at close range were scattered on the streets after Russian troops withdrew from the city. "Stop this war! Let the weapons fall silent! Stop sowing death and destruction," he said at the end of his weekly audience at the Vatican.

372.title: MI, KKR announce playing XIs for their IPL 2022 clash, Baby AB makes debut
372.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against MI. Both the teams have made two changes each to their playing XIs. Pat Cummins and Rasikh Salam replaced Tim Southee and Shivam Mavi for KKR. For MI, Suryakumar Yadav has replaced Anmolpreet Singh and 18-year-old Dewald Brevis, who's nicknamed Baby AB, is making his IPL debut.

373.title: Earth likely to be hit by geomagnetic storm today and tomorrow
373.article_body: Earth is expected to be hit by a geomagnetic storm on Wednesday and Thursday, as per a forecast by Space Weather Prediction Center of National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). However, it'll be a minor one, NOAA said, categorising it as G1. NOAA said a coronal mass ejection from an approximately 25-degree-long filament lifted off the Sun on March 3.

374.title: US approves sale of air defence system worth $95 million to Taiwan
374.article_body: The US Defence Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) on Tuesday said the US has approved the potential sale to Taiwan of equipment, training and other items to support the Patriot Air Defence System in a deal worth $95 million. "The proposed sale will help to sustain the recipient's missile density and ensure readiness for air operations," the Pentagon said.

375.title: Ex-Burkina Faso Prez sentenced to life in prison over predecessor's murder
375.article_body: Ex-Burkina Faso President Blaise Compaoré was sentenced to life imprisonment for complicity in 1987 murder of his predecessor Thomas Sankara, a military tribunal ruled on Wednesday. Sankara was gunned down in Ouagadougou, four years after he assumed power. Compaoré, who has been in exile since 2014, was charged along with his former head of security, who received the same sentence.

376.title: AAP MLA visits school as chief guest where his mother works as sweeper in Punjab
376.article_body: AAP's Bhadaur MLA, Labh Singh Ugoke, visited a government school as chief guest where his mother has been working as a sanitation worker for last 25 years. "'Jhadu' is an important part of my life. I'll continue to do my duty at the school," she said. Ugoke, who was a mobile repair shop worker, had defeated ex-CM Charanjit Singh Channi.

377.title: BJP should live up to its Constitution: Tharoor on party's foundation day
377.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor took to Twitter on Wednesday to address the BJP on its 42nd foundation day. Sharing a picture of the first page of BJP's Constitution, he tweeted, "Happy birthday BJP! You turn 42 today. Isn't it time to start living up to your own Constitution?" Tharoor added that BJP doesn't adhere to anything written on the page.

378.title: Cong helping BJP create false narrative of lawlessness in WB: TMC
378.article_body: TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh on Wednesday said Congress is helping BJP in creating a "false narrative" about alleged lawlessness in West Bengal and in maligning the state government. On the unnatural death of Congress councillor Tapan Kundu's murder's eyewitness, Ghosh said, "The way TMC and the state police are being blamed for it is unacceptable. We condemn it."

379.title: European Union proposes ban on Russian coal amid new sanctions
379.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said the EU is set to impose further sanctions on Russia following its invasion of Ukraine including a ban on Russian coal imports. "To take a clear stand is not only crucial for us in Europe but also for the rest of the world," Von der Leyen added.

380.title: Driver dies after ramming car into Russian Embassy in Bucharest
380.article_body: Police on Wednesday said a car crashed into the gate of the Russian Embassy in Bucharest, Romania before bursting into flames and killing the driver. Police said firefighters arrived on the scene and were able to put out the fire. No immediate information has been given on a possible motive of the driver. The embassy said no employees were injured.

381.title: Netherlands prevents 14 Russian yachts from leaving over sanctions
381.article_body: The Dutch government said it is preventing 14 Russian yachts, including 12 under construction, from leaving the country due to sanctions imposed on Russia. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a letter to parliament there are no "superyachts" anchored in any Dutch territories. The letter added that €516 million in assets and €155 million in transactions have been frozen.

382.title: Man arrested for killing woman by breaking coconut on her head in Thane
382.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly murdering a 78-year-old woman by breaking a coconut on her head near a temple in Murbad, Thane, where she went to worship on March 23. The accused attacked her as he wanted to rob her. He later dumped the body in a nearby forest and her body was found three days later.

383.title: Peddler, 2 consumers held in Hyd, 840 gms of hash oil seized
383.article_body: Officers of the Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing, along with Nallakunta Police, seized 840 grams of hash oil and held a drug supplier, peddler and two consumers. The prime accused V Lakshmipathi was addicted to hash oil and sold it to people in Hyderabad through his drug network because his earnings weren't enough to support his expenditures, the report said.

384.title: Russian action in Ukraine's Bucha doesn't look far short of genocide: UK
384.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Wednesday said the actions of Russian President Vladimir Putin's forces in the Ukrainian town of Bucha "doesn't look far short of genocide". PM Johnson pledged to impose more sanctions and more penalties on Putin's regime. Mayor of Bucha had said that over 200 people have been buried in a mass grave after Russian troops retreated.

385.title: Hyd Police busts IPL betting racket, seize material worth ₹56 lakh
385.article_body: A Special Operations Team of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police Commissionerate busted an online IPL betting racket, arrested seven people and seized incriminating property worth ₹56 lakh. According to the report, the officers found ₹31,17,576 in three bank accounts belonging to the main accused and also seized cash worth ₹11,80,00, along with a laptop and nine mobile phones.

386.title: A girl once rejected my proposal, I said 'You have rejected Kohinoor diamond': Dhawan
386.article_body: PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan, in a video shared by the IPL franchise, said a girl once rejected his proposal. Dhawan added, "She used to play at that time and had a dark face tone. I told her, 'You've rejected the Kohinoor diamond'." The video presenter then jokingly said, "Today, the girl would be crying, tucking her face in her pillow."

387.title: India trying to stabilise economic transactions with Russia: Govt
387.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday said India is trying to stabilise economic transactions with Russia, a day after India condemned killings of civilians in Ukraine. Jaishankar added that India has chosen the "side of peace" in the Russia-Ukraine war. Russia is India's main supplier of defence hardware but the overall annual trade between the two countries is small.

388.title: No tie-up with BJP in Maharashtra: Sharad Pawar
388.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday said there'll be no tie-up between his party and BJP. Criticising the alleged misuse of central investigative agencies, Pawar said Maharashtra's Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government is strong and stable and will return to power in the next Assembly elections. There'll be no change in the MVA Cabinet from NCP's side, he added.

389.title: ATS group firm goes into insolvency; may affect homebuyers of Gurugram project
389.article_body: Insolvency proceedings have been initiated against ATS group firm Anand Divine Developers after ICICI Prudential Venture filed a petition for non-payment of dues worth ₹25 crore. Over 443 homebuyers of the ATS Triumph project in Gurugram's Sector 104 will likely be impacted. PSP Legal's partner Piyush Singh, who is representing the project's buyers, said homebuyers must file claims immediately.

390.title: Delhi isn't Gotham City: TMC on ban on meat shops during Navratri
390.article_body: Trinamool Congress national spokesperson Saket Gokhale has written a letter to the Municipal Commissioner of South Delhi and demanded an immediate circular announcing that the ban on meat shops during Navratri is illegal. "Delhi isn't Gotham City," Gokhale said, referring to a fictional city in Batman comic books. He added that the Mayor has no executive powers to shut shops.

391.title: India to see 48,000 more EV chargers in next 3-4 years: ICRA
391.article_body: Ratings agency ICRA on Wednesday said India is likely to see around 48,000 additional electric vehicle (EV) chargers at an investment of around ₹14,000 crore over the next 3-4 years. It added that by FY25, electric two-wheeler penetration is expected to be around 13-15%. "India remains a laggard in EV charging infrastructure penetration," ICRA Vice President Shamsher Dewan said.

392.title: Man dies by suicide over debt concerns in Kolkata, informs wife
392.article_body: A man allegedly died by suicide after he jumped from a commercial high-rise building in Kolkata's Park Street area on Tuesday evening, police said. The man, who was reportedly working in the same building, was apparently depressed over debt concerns, a police officer said. He had messaged his wife before taking the step, the officer added.

393.title: Proof that unseen hands were behind hijab issue: Minister as Al-Qaeda praises Muskan
393.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said the video statement released by Al-Qaeda chief Ayman Al Zawahiri on the hijab controversy proves involvement of "unseen hands" behind the issue. Zawahiri praised BCom student Muskan for standing in defence of hijab and chanting 'Allah-hu-Akbar' in February. "All these things are being looked into by the police," the minister added.

394.title: TMC leader summoned by CBI over cattle smuggling, goes to hospital
394.article_body: TMC leader Anubrata Mondal, who was summoned by the CBI on Wednesday in connection to a cattle smuggling case, went to a state-run hospital in Kolkata. He told CBI he meant to appear before it but suddenly started suffering from shortness of breath, lightheadedness and cold sweat. He sought to dispense himself for appearing at CBI office for four weeks.

395.title: Excited to work with Charlize Theron in 'Fast & Furious 10': Jason
395.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa, speaking about working in 'Fast & Furious 10', has said, "I get to shoot with some really cool people that I have never [worked with before]." Jason further said that he is "excited" to work with actress Charlize Theron, who portrays Cipher in the film. The actor added that Charlize is "amazing".

396.title: 3 cheat credit card users in Delhi on pretext of increasing limit; held
396.article_body: Three men were arrested in Delhi for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of increasing their credit cards limit, police said on Wednesday. Two laptops, 20 mobile phones, 45 SIM cards and six diaries have been recovered from the accused, the police added. The matter came to light after a victim complained that the accused cheated them of ₹34,425.

397.title: Man in his 30s killed in hit-and-run by a vehicle in Delhi
397.article_body: A man in his 30s was killed after he was hit by a vehicle in Delhi's Wazirabad on Wednesday morning, police said. The vehicle driver ran away from the spot after the accident. Police did not find any document related to the man at the spot and efforts were being made to identify him.

398.title: Pune man cheated of ₹12 lakh by fraudster promising low-cost steel
398.article_body: Pune Police have busted a gang for allegedly defrauding people online through fake online offers of low-cost steel. Two people have been arrested and another accomplice was booked after a businessman was cheated of ₹12.04 lakh by one of them, who promised victim affordable steel, police said. The victim, who made the purchase online, had received a fake GST number.

399.title: Hyd Police conducts special drive to remove tinted glass from vehicles
399.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Wednesday conducted a special drive against the tinted glass, improper number plates and stickers like MLA, Police and Press on vehicles. The police also imposed challans against the violating vehicles. Recently, the city police had reportedly fined Telugu actor Allu Arjun ₹700 for using tinted window shields on his luxury car.

400.title: Hand grenade thrown at worshippers in Afghanistan mosque; 6 injured
400.article_body: At least six people were left injured in a blast that was reported at a mosque in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Wednesday, an Afghan police spokesperson said. The blast reportedly took place after someone threw a hand grenade at the worshippers during afternoon prayers at the 18th century Pul-e-Khishti mosque. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack so far.
